<h3><span style="text-decoration: underline;">Namtok Phlio National Park</span>:</h3>

<p style="text-align: justify;">Right behind Chanthaburi is Namtok Phlio National Park. Without a foreigner on the spot, you will be greeted by nothing but emerald green leaves and local Thais swimming in emerald pools. Be sure to bring your swimwear, as there are plenty of swimming pools to stay in while you travel to cool off, swim with the local tourists, and go fishing. There are also plenty of food stalls and vendors leading to the park, as well as bungalows for rent - if you find you don''t want to go out quickly, they''ll keep you covered.</p>

<h3><span style="text-decoration: underline;">Ao Phang Nga National Park</span>:</h3>

<p style="text-align: justify;">Covering a bay surrounded by 42 karst islands, limestone cliffs, caves, beautiful beaches, and lagoons, it is one of the most famous national parks in Thailand. Take a boat to explore Koh Panak Cave or visit James Bond Island, Khao Phing Kan, where the Bond movie was filmed. The emerald Andaman Sea also fosters the development of native mangrove vegetation discovered on the boat.Thailand, although it is not as expensive as the rest of the luxury places on earth. </p>

<h3><span style="text-decoration: underline;">Khao Yai National Park</span>:</h3>

<p style="text-align: justify;">Located just 2.5 hours from Bangkok, Khao Yai National Park is Thailand''s first national park. This national park has also been awarded as a UNESCO World Heritage Site to protect endangered species worldwide. Khao Yai National Park covers a vast territory consisting of rain-forests, evergreen forests, and grasslands, and is home to a large population of mammals, birds, and reptiles. Tourists, especially like Khao Yai National Park, as around 200 wild elephants roam the park, providing visitors with ample opportunities to see the majestic creatures in their natural habitat.</p>

<h3><span style="text-decoration: underline;">Mu KO Similan National Park</span>:</h3>

<p style="text-align: justify;">These granite islands are just as beautiful by the water as they are below, crowned with rainforest, surrounded by white beaches and coral reefs. The water is very clear from December to April, making it a good time for snorkeling and diving. Some islands, such as Ko Miang and Ko Similan, have hotels and restaurants. Several companies offer diving trips to the islands. On some of them, you can stay on board the boat for a few nights and go on diving trips during the day. Taking Kuwait airways flight deals is one of the best ways to reach Thailand because of the comfort level at very low prices.</p>

<h3><span style="text-decoration: underline;">Kui Buri National Park</span>:</h3>

<p style="text-align: justify;">Kui Buri National Park is rich in moist and dry evergreen forests and abounds with different species of palm trees. The fauna consists of the Asian elephant, Malayan tapir, gibbons, black bear, black bear, macaque, tiger, leopard, sambar, banteng, and muntjac Fea. The various wildlife viewing platforms at Pa Yang will allow you to enjoy watching the elephants take a mud bath and splash in the water. Bring your car or go on a 4x4 truck tour.</p>

<p style="text-align: justify;">You can even spend a night in the wild by renting bungalows and tents, or go hiking for miles to the 15-tier Dong Ma Fai Falls.</p>

<h3><span style="text-decoration: underline;">Erawan National Park</span>:</h3>

<p style="text-align: justify;">It is located in the Kanchanaburi province. One of the park''s main attractions is Erawan Falls, a seven-tier waterfall named after an elephant in Hindu mythology. You can climb this waterfall and swim in the pools. The easiest way to get to the park is by bus from Kanchanaburi, which takes around an hour and a half. Many buses are running every day, so it''s an easy trip.</p>

<p style="text-align: justify;">If you want to spend more than one day in Erawan National Park, you can camp or rent a cottage. People who take <a href="https://www.faremakers.com/"><strong>affordable airline tickets</strong></a> always avail more enjoyable opportunities because they save a lot of money by traveling cheaply, and it is also recommended.</p>

<h3><span style="text-decoration: underline;">Kaeng Krachan National Park</span>:</h3>

<p style="text-align: justify;">This national park in Thailand near Bangkok is famous for its highest density of butterfly species and more than 420 species of birds, including shaker tail, giant pitta, woolly stork, and all endemic Broadbill and Hornbill species. Many snakes can be seen here, such as the Oriental Vine Snake, Siamese Cat Snake, Redhead Krait, Mountain Pit Viper, and Blue Coral Snake. Enjoy a boat ride on the lake and rivers, or take a hike around Pa La-U and Thorthip Falls. Camping in the control room can be fun too!</p>

<p style="text-align: justify;">New Year is coming and there is only one week. <h3><strong><u>Resolutions of New Year</u></strong></h3>

<h3><strong><u>Resolution of Learning, Understanding Quran</u></strong></h3>

<h3><span style="text-decoration: underline;">3.	Up to Date Currency Exchange Rates</span>:</h3>

<p style="text-align: justify;">When you are deciding where to apply for study abroad, then many students assume that the US dollar had the same worth as five months ago. No, it’s not so that because currency values change every day basis. small differences can make a big impact on your budgets. So, update yourself from the currency ups and down and timely exchange your currency with abroad currency. Students don’t bother this step of currency; therefore we are mentioning this step in the basic things.</p>

<h3><span style="text-decoration: underline;">4.	Register with Home-Government</span>:</h3>

<p style="text-align: justify;">Students are going overseas, might be any hurdle can drop the contact,  might be possible that your Wi-Fi signal going to weak or spotty, your phone going to out of coverage due to the huge distance, sometime may you are on your research project and can’t able to answering your phone. In all that condition obviously your families worried rapidly about you, to remove these worries, you should register your semester with your home-government, the government has become on their radar and knows who to contact in an emergency.</p>
<h3><span style="text-decoration: underline;">5. Consult With Embassy</span>:</h3>

<p style="text-align: justify;">In case of any trouble you first go the embassy of that state. Keep safe the phone number in your diary or in the phone, this type of services always active 24/7 for the help. But it is possible when you use your senses and immediately contact with the embassy and call them for help. When you have the embassy contact number, then you need to worry.</p>

</div>', N'<p style="text-align: justify;">Pakistan International Airlines remains under the travel restriction that European Union had imposed a while ago. Here''s what you need to know.</p>

<p style="text-align: justify;">Let''s face it; we are living in the darkest of the times of the current century. More than tens of thousands of people have lost their lives, but the world''s economy is still significantly affected. Moreover, the old tourism and air travel environment that once used to be is still sitting on the fence. All the countries around the globe are going the extra mile to make sure that covid-19 doesn''t spread anymore, but at some places, the results are not as desired. Unfortunately, our country is experiencing the same currently. That''s why European Union Aviation has yet again extended the travel restrictions on <a href="https://www.faremakers.com/pakistan-international-airlines-flights"><strong>Pakistan International Airlines</strong></a>.</p>

<h3><span style="text-decoration: underline;">Details of the Current Matter</span>!</h3>

<p style="text-align: justify;">The EASA (European Union Aviation Safety Agency) has decided that the imposed restriction on PIA will be extended. Moreover, the Agency has also not declared any solid-state period and has directed the PCAA (Pakistan Civil Aviation Authority) that the country needs its safety audit done by the ICAO (International Civil Aviation Organization). It''s scheduled for near July, and after its success, you''ll book your cheap air tickets to Europe.</p>

<p>

<h3><span style="text-decoration: underline;">The Earlier Restriction</span>!</h3>

<p style="text-align: justify;">It''s essential to keep in mind that the European Union restricted Pakistan for the first time because of covid-19 in July 2020. The Agency has decided to carry on this restriction, and it was decided on 31st March 2021. At that time, it was announced that the restriction is imposed for an additional three months. But the latest intimation that the Agency sent to Pakistan signifies that it''s still not defined that for how long this restriction will continue. The EASA (European Union Aviation Safety Agency) has also mentioned that when the restriction is lifted from Pakistan International Airlines, it will be notified again.</p>

<h3><span style="text-decoration: underline;">The reasoning of the Restriction Extension</span>!</h3>

<p style="text-align: justify;">The reasoning that the EASA (European Union Aviation Safety Agency) provided is that all the crew members and engineers that it holds don''t hold Pakistan''s license. It means that they won''t fully mitigate all the possible concerns about the authority''s oversight capabilities.</p>

<p style="text-align: justify;">A letter from EASA (European Union Aviation Safety Agency) stated that the restriction would remain the same until the next ICAO audit and its results. <div class="custShortContent">



	<div class="custImageBlog">


		<img src="https://firebasestorage.googleapis.com/v0/b/faremakers-connect.appspot.com/o/blogimages%2F84384293-13ae-404a-9556-5d95d5fd83bf.gif?alt=media&token=6782a4b9-e6ba-44f8-ab9f-3d0d0d2210c4" alt="3-days-itinerary-for-bangkok" title="3-days-itinerary-for-bangkok" class="picture" />

	</div>



	<div class="custTitle">


	    <p></p>


	</div>


</div>', N'<p style="text-align: justify;">Bangkok is the city that never stops. It is the capital of Thailand and posses various identities. Some people call the greatest city in the world, while others bluntly term it the best spot for foodies. The unending commotion of the city will surely stir your soul and appeal your senses.</p>

<p style="text-align: justify;">If you are planning to visit this lively city through <a href="https://www.faremakers.com/"><strong>Cheap Flight Tickets</strong></a>, it is important to first know about the whole itinerary plan so that you should not waste your time. To help you in your traveling endeavors, we have come up with a comprehensive 3-days itinerary guide to Bangkok. Following our guide will not only save your time but will also enable you deeply explore this vibrant city.</p>

<h3><span style="text-decoration: underline;">Day 1</span>:</h3>

<p style="text-align: justify;">You can start your first day in this magical city by visiting the temples, China road, and the notorious Khao San Road. You need to get up early because the sun would be severe, and the walls of the temples absorb the heat, meaning that it would be like an oven. After having breakfast from a nearby restaurant, you need to pack your bag for Wat Pho.</p>

<h3><span style="text-decoration: underline;">Wat Pho</span>:</h3>

<p style="text-align: justify;">One of the oldest temples in the city, Wat Pho is truly a dazzling place. It is also called the temple of reclining Buddha because a 50m long statue of Buddha is erected here. The statue is immensely impressive, and taking the photo of the whole statue is challenging because it is too long. Thais come here and donate money just to fill their next life with enlightenment. You can book <a href="https://www.faremakers.com/pakistan-international-airlines-flights"><strong>PIA Online Ticket</strong></a> if you want to visit Bangkok from Pakistan.</p>

<h3><span style="text-decoration: underline;">The Grand Palace</span>:</h3>

<p style="text-align: justify;">The Grand Palace was the official residence of the Kings of Siam. It is located near the Wat Pho temple, and you will not have any complications in exploring it. The primary attractions here are Emerald Buddha, gardens, and the Abhisek Dusit Throne Hall.</p>

<h3><span style="text-decoration: underline;">Khao San Road</span>:</h3>

<p style="text-align: justify;">Khao San Road is the perfect place to spend the night of your first day. The area bustles with the energetic crowd who are always thinking about the party. Here, you can taste the delicious cuisine and then shop from the bustling outlets.</p>

<p>
<strong>Must Read:</strong> <a style="color:Purple;" href="https://blog.faremakers.com/Blog/2019/10/31/things-to-do-in-bangkok-for-new-travelers"><strong>Things To Do In Bangkok</strong></a>
</p>

<h3><span style="text-decoration: underline;">Day 2</span>:</h3>

<p style="text-align: justify;">You have spent eventful first day, and now it is time to go to the far off areas of Bangkok. You will see the modern areas of Bangkok on the day 2 of your itinerary. The ideal places to explore innovation in the city are shopping malls.</p>

<h3><span style="text-decoration: underline;">Terminal 21</span>:</h3>

<p style="text-align: justify;">You can reach Terminal 21 by taking a Skytrain to Asok. This shopping mall has various floors, each representing a different city. These cities include Tokyo, Istanbul, Paris, London, and San Francisco. The mall hosts a wide range of recreational spots, including cinemas, gaming places and restaurants.</p>

<h3><span style="text-decoration: underline;">Siam</span>:</h3>

<p style="text-align: justify;">The Skytrain Silom can also take you to Siam. Siam is awash with shopping centers ready to be explored. The Siam Discovery Center has recently been renovated and now boasts itself with a stunning Exploratorium. Each of the floors has statue-type artwork and glorious walls.</p>

<h3><span style="text-decoration: underline;">Sky Bar At Lebua</span>:</h3>

<p style="text-align: justify;">Our today’s article would not be complete until a visit to the lavish rooftop bar of the city. Sky Bar at Lebua is considered the highest open-air bar in the world as it is on the 63rd floor of the building. The elegant ambience of innovative cocktails is what makes the Sky Bar at Lebua the most iconic tourist attraction. Try to come here at sunset as the views from the top will leave you spellbound.</p>

<h3><span style="text-decoration: underline;">Day 3</span>:</h3>

<p style="text-align: justify;">On the last day of your journey, you should get out of the city completely. And the best way to do is to visit the spacious parks and the natural fields. The Tree House is an eco-friendly hotel where you will genuinely get lost in the serenity of Bangkok.</p>

<h3><span style="text-decoration: underline;">Bang Krachao</span>:</h3>

<p style="text-align: justify;">Bang Krachao is a piece of lush green land near the Chao Praya River. It is basically a jungle where the rugged paths will take you above the plants and trees. There is also a country park with a pristine lake in the center. People come here whenever they want to get rid of their exhaustion. So, if you are also feeling tired, Bang Krachao is an ideal choice.</p>

<h3><span style="text-decoration: underline;">Ratchada Train Market</span>:</h3>

<p style="text-align: justify;">The Ratchada Train Market depicts a blend of local culture and the magnificent rural life of the city. It is a night market, and its real charm starts after sunset. As soon as the sun goes down, the market begins bustling with the stalls of food, drink, and essential commodities. Surprisingly, the market also hosts a number of DJs who entertain visitors with loud music.</p>

<h3><span style="text-decoration: underline;">Conclusion</span>:</h3>

<p style="text-align: justify;">At the end of your journey, you can head to the Don Mueang International Airport and pick the flight for your native country. We hope that this guide would have helped you in guiding you on how to spend your days in Bangkok without disruption.</p>', N'the-perfect-3-days-itinerary-for-bangkok', N'Hamza Farooq', NULL, 824, 1, CAST(N'2020-01-24T09:00:00.0000000+00:00' AS DateTimeOffset), CAST(N'2024-03-19T14:16:25.3966667+00:00' AS DateTimeOffset), CAST(N'2024-03-19T14:16:25.3966667+00:00' AS DateTimeOffset), 1)

In today’s piece, we have unveiled all the places in Kuala Lumpur where you will be able to create striking memories. Let’s get started.</p>

<h3>1.	<span style="text-decoration: underline;">PETRONAS Twin Towers</span>:</h3>

<p style="text-align: justify;">If you are suffering from acrophobia (fear of heights), then you need to think twice before visiting the PETRONAS Twin Towers. However, if you have an adventurous nature, then you can challenge yourself and look out over the city from hundreds of feet in the air. At the height of 170 meters, the world’s highest double-check bridge connects the two towers together. The tower one is occupied by the Malaysian state oil company, while the second tower is taken up by international companies, including Al-Jazeera, Microsoft, Boeing, and more.</p>

<p style="text-align: justify;">Surprisingly, the towers are even higher than the bridge, soaring 40 meters into the sky. It took the laborers seven years to build these landmark towers.</p>

<h3>2.	<span style="text-decoration: underline;">Batu Caves</span>:</h3>

<p style="text-align: justify;">Batu Caves is a limestone hill comprising bigger and smaller caves. The hill is located about 11 km north of the Kuala Lumpur and features the 100-year-old statues and idols erected inside the main caves. Amazingly, the caves are guarded by a colossal statue of the Hindu deity Murugan. There is also a Hindu temple here, which is said to be around 400 million years old.</p>
<p>
<strong>Must Read:</strong> <a style="color:Purple;" href="https://blog.faremakers.com/Blog/2019/12/20/the-6-most-beautiful-islands-in-the-world"><strong>Beautiful Islands In World</strong></a>
</p>
<p style="text-align: justify;">Once you enter inside the caves, you will see monkeys preying on the tourist treks, bats fluttering in the shadows, and walls glowing beneath the minerals. Since hundreds of thousands of pilgrims converge here for the Thaipusam festival in February, it is the best time to come here.</p>

<h3>3.	<span style="text-decoration: underline;">KLCC Park</span>:</h3>

<p style="text-align: justify;">KLCC Park is the largest urban park in the city with a 50-acre sanctuary for both humans and animals. It is located at the feet of the famous PETRONAS Twin Towers and has more than 2000 species of palms and flora. Its trees are planted in such a way that they attract not only the local and but also the migratory birds.</p>

<p style="text-align: justify;">The primary attraction of the park is Lake Symphony. It is a massive lake that has a 43-meter bridge and a number of fountains that can shoot the water 180 meters up into the sky. The fountain becomes immensely impressive at night when you can witness its changing colors against the backdrop of the luminous PETRONAS Towers. Since there are no entry charges for the park, you can experience the dazzling splendor free of cost.</p>

<h3>4.	<span style="text-decoration: underline;">National Museum</span>:</h3>

<p style="text-align: justify;">The National Museum of Malaysia is an architectural wonder that showcases the traditional decorations with a mixture of contemporary and classical design. You can visit this museum if you want to learn the history and culture of Malaysia or to observe the replicas of ancient houses and wedding scenes. Furthermore, the museum also hosts various exhibitions where the national costumes and artifacts are displayed.  The museum also has several guided tours that will help you to explore the nitty-gritty of Malaysian history thoroughly. People living in Pakistan can get the tickets for Kuala Lumpur through <a href="https://www.faremakers.com/pakistan-international-airlines-flights"><strong>PIA Online Booking</strong></a>.</p>

<h3>5.	<span style="text-decoration: underline;">Aquaria KLCC</span>:</h3>

<p style="text-align: justify;">Housed in the depth of Kuala Lumpur Convention Center, the Aquaria KLCC is a 300 ft tunnel that allows the visitors to experience the depths up close as they are surrounded by water. The aquarium is built to educate the people on Malaysian aquatic life.</p>

<p style="text-align: justify;">The Aquaria houses more than 250 different species and over 5000 aquatic and land animals from all around the world. The visitors can get personal with the tiger sharks, stingrays, and other enigmatic sea creatures you might not know about. Plus, there is also an entertaining tank in the aquarium where the people of all ages can take a plunge and drench in the warm water.</p>

<h3><span style="text-decoration: underline;">Bottom Line</span>:</h3>

<p style="text-align: justify;">It does not matter what type of taste people have in traveling; they will find something captivating in Kuala Lumpur.  The growing city is full of cultural commotion, and you will certainly be overwhelmed by the influence of diverse cultures. So don’t wait and book your ticket for Kuala Lumpur through <strong>faremakers.com</strong> to save big!</p>', N'5-cheapest-places-to-visit-in-kuala-lumpur', N'Hamza Farooq', NULL, 697, 1, CAST(N'2019-12-21T09:00:00.0000000+00:00' AS DateTimeOffset), CAST(N'2024-03-19T14:16:25.3966667+00:00' AS DateTimeOffset), CAST(N'2024-03-19T14:16:25.3966667+00:00' AS DateTimeOffset), 1)

It will also help the country lift the restrictions that are currently in effect from the countries where it’s safe to travel. <h3><span style="text-decoration: underline;">Details of the Traffic Light System</span>!</h3>

<p style="text-align: justify;">It’s a system that will automatically slot different countries under the green, amber, and red system. It will help the United Kingdom government determine that passengers from which countries are required to have a home or hotel quarantine along with the stringent COVID-19 testing system also in place. However, all the countries'' full categorisation under this traffic light system is yet to be launched. It is expected that that will be released for the next stage of the current lockdown, which will take place on 17th May 2021.</p>

<p style="text-align: justify;">The countries under the Amber category will be considered medium risk, and they will need to quarantine for ten days and will also need to take a test before departing along with PCR.</p>

</div>', N'<p style="text-align: justify;">One of the best things about traveling, no matter where you are, is trying new foods, and <a href="https://www.faremakers.com/etihad-airways-flights"><strong>Etihad Airlines flights</strong></a> allow you to experience different cultures, foods, and places. Every country and city has its must-try list - and Toronto is no exception. It is a city of many cultures, each bringing its flavor to Toronto''s varied and exciting food scene. There''s always something great to eat in the city, from food trucks and stalls to bar snacks and fine dining. With that in mind, whether you live in Toronto, or are visiting for the first or fifth time, here are some of the dishes you must try in Toronto.</p>

<h3><span style="text-decoration: underline;">Gran Fritto Misto</span>:</h3>

<p style="text-align: justify;">The plate of gran Fritto Misto in this casual setting in Little Italy, intended for shared use, is a decadent mess of fried snacks. In a golden and perfectly crispy pile, you can find rapini, zucchini, cauliflower, many other seasonal vegetables, arancini, and a changing list of seafood. Everything is hot from the refrigerator, a special fryer imported from Naples.</p>

<h3><span style="text-decoration: underline;">Macarons</span>:</h3>

<p style="text-align: justify;">A rainbow of pastel macaroons await behind the glass counters of Nadège Patisserie and while there are plenty of sweet treats to choose from, all worth trying, the perfectly delicate macaroons are hard to resist and limiting to one is a lot harder than it sounds. The flavors change, but you can expect more unique offerings like cotton candy, rose or match a green tea, and raspberry, among more traditional offerings like chocolate, vanilla, and salted caramel. If you are from Pakistan, you can easily find LHE YYZ flights that are the carrier of your choice because these flights are readily available.</p>

<h3><span style="text-decoration: underline;">Jerk Lobster</span>:</h3>

<p style="text-align: justify;">Toronto hosts many Chinese and Jamaican restaurants. However, Chef Craig Wong''s Dundas West is the only place to combine both culinary influences into one menu seamlessly. Patois Toronto''s most favorite dish is the Lobster Prosperity Jerk. It was originally served as a Lunar New Year special, but when Wong tried to pull it off the menu, a commotion broke out, making the dish a permanent home.</p>

<p>
<strong>Must Read:</strong> <a style="color:Purple;" href="https://blog.faremakers.com/Blog/2020/10/3/now-book-saudi-airlines-flights-from-pakistan-to-saudi-arabia"><strong>Book Saudi Airlines Flights From Pakistan</strong></a>
</p>

<p style="text-align: justify;">Wok-fried Hong Kong-style lobster is first cooked in court broth. It is then added to homemade Jamaican jerk paste and a healthy dose of butter and topped with a fresh hit of coriander and lime.</p>

<h3><span style="text-decoration: underline;">Rasta Pasta</span>:</h3>

<p style="text-align: justify;">Fusion cuisine is a classic dish worldwide, but the Italian-Jamaican couple, Rasta noodles, guarantees a double dose. Jamaican influence comes from co-owner Magnus Patterson, and Italian slim comes from his co-owner and associate Mary Neglia. Follow Jamaican steel drums'' sounds that lure passers-by and order reggae lasagna. Traditional Italian layers of ricotta, mozzarella, and fresh pasta flirting with spicy tomato sauce and steamed squid are served.</p>

<h3><span style="text-decoration: underline;">Churros</span>:</h3>

<p style="text-align: justify;">Anyone craving something sweet while in Toronto should consider going to one of the two Panchos Bakery locations for a freshly fried churro. Here, you''ll be served with decadent deep-fried dough sticks coated in cinnamon and sugar and then filled with a variety of fillings ranging from chocolate to caramel and jam. Chocolate is especially delicious, but you can also get it plain. Whenever you take your Etihad Airlines flights to Toronto, do not miss Churros at all costs.</p>

<h3><span style="text-decoration: underline;">Nanaimo Bar</span>:</h3>

<p style="text-align: justify;">The three-layer no-bake cake is named after Nanaimo in British Columbia, but the sweet delicacy has become the country''s unofficial national dessert. No one knows where it came from, but since the recipe became popular in the 1950s, a blend of powdered pudding, graham cracker crumbs, and cocoa has hit the shelves of coffee shops gourmet menus. Distillery District, a Brick Street Bakery dealer, is the perfect version - best enjoyed while walking along the area''s cobbled streets.</p>

<h3><span style="text-decoration: underline;">Margherita pizza</span>:</h3>

<p style="text-align: justify;">You can probably debate for days about where to get the best Margherita pizza in Toronto, but the North Brooklyn cakes are hard to beat. Everything is made from local ingredients, resulting in a crispy crust with the right amount of chewing and a sauce that provides the right acidity for creamy mozzarella. If you''re really hungry, order garlic knots made from leftover dough and spread with garlic butter.</p>

<p style="text-align: justify;">Taking <a href="https://www.faremakers.com/flights/cheap-flights-from-lahore-to-toronto"><strong>LHE YYZ Flights</strong></a> is one of the easiest ways to experience cultural beauty and, most importantly, Toronto''s food for all the Pakistanis.</p>

<h3><span style="text-decoration: underline;">Belgian fries</span>:</h3>

<p style="text-align: justify;">Fresh fries aren''t difficult in most cities, and Toronto is no exception. Not all types of fries are cooked equally, and we all know it. Spuds are Belgian-style fried, meaning they are thick, golden, crispy, and fluffy inside. For an extra dollar, they can be fried in beef fat, which is highly recommended. Oh, and forget the usual ketchup. There are 18 different homemade sauces to decorate your fries with.</p>

<h3><span style="text-decoration: underline;">Khao Soi</span>:</h3>

<p style="text-align: justify;">Creamy, flavorful, and fun to eat, Pai Northern Kitchen''s Khao soy is often described as better than what people remember eating in Thailand. Fresh egg noodles are swimming in a golden curry with crispy noodles, coriander, green onions, and a choice of braised beef, prawns, chicken breast, or chicken drumsticks. Whether you''ve been to Northern Thailand or not, feel like you''ve been transported with this uniquely aromatic dish.</p>

</div>', N'<p style="text-align: justify;">All the world industries are making changes and bringing new reforms to make all their operations free from the risk of coronavirus. That’s why airports from all across the globe are also applying new precautionary measures to make sure that all the passengers remain safe.</p>

<h3><span style="text-decoration: underline;">But should we buy their trust</span>?</h3>

<p style="text-align: justify;">At the start of the pandemic, people infected with the virus boarded planes and rapidly spread epidemics around the world. But whether planes were a dangerous place to contaminate and infect others was a more open question. In all actuality, we don''t have the foggiest idea about the appropriate response yet. There are several high-quality studies on aircraft transmission, and they all contain important caveats and uncertainties.</p>

<p style="text-align: justify;">Although you can these days easily find <a href="https://www.faremakers.com/"><strong>affordable airline tickets</strong></a> it certainly doesn’t mean that you’ll also be protected from the virus. That why airports are taking many precautionary measures to make air travel safe.</p>

<h3><span style="text-decoration: underline;">Precautions by Airports</span>:</h3>

<p style="text-align: justify;">Airport operators across the country say this fear of airline passengers has helped lower air travel demand by almost 65 percent compared to last year. In response, they have attempted to change the way Americans fly in hopes of reducing the risk of the coronavirus spreading and encouraging travelers to take to the skies again in pre-pandemic numbers.</p>

<h3><span style="text-decoration: underline;">Virtual queuing</span>:</h3>

<p style="text-align: justify;">To avoid crowds and long lines that could increase the risk of exposure to the virus, consortium members want to convince travelers to book their arrival time at the airport using a smartphone app, as well as time to line up for security checks. checkpoints and time to get to the gate. The timetable system, which has not yet been adopted, aims to improve the flow of passengers through the lines of the Transport Safety Administration and other narrow points.</p>

<p style="text-align: justify;">Passengers could also reserve seats at their gates. Travellers who make such a booking will wait for their flights in seats separated from other passengers or separated by a barrier.</p>

<p>
<strong>Must Read:</strong> <a style="color:Purple;" href="https://blog.faremakers.com/Blog/2020/11/24/kuwait-airways-now-operating-worlds-first-passenger-a330-800-flights"><strong>Kuwait Airways Operating A330-800 Flights</strong></a>
</p>

<h3><span style="text-decoration: underline;">Enhanced Ventilation System</span>:</h3>

<p style="text-align: justify;">Consortium individuals additionally state that air terminals can decrease the danger of infection spreading by expanding wind current in terminals and redesigning existing warming, ventilation, and cooling (HVAC) frameworks to move through bright light, slaughtering airborne infections.</p>

<p style="text-align: justify;">These changes, coupled with the strict enforcement of the wearing of masks, can make a difference. She pointed out that the Centers for Disease Control and Prevention and the World Health Organisation recommend increasing ventilation in buildings.</p>

<h3><span style="text-decoration: underline;">Self-Serve Contactless Systems</span>:</h3>

<p style="text-align: justify;">Facial recognition technology, which has already been tested to confirm the identity of foreign travelers, should also be used for domestic travelers. These systems are applied in both conditions while getting affordable airline tickets and while boarding. It reduces the need for travelers to have close contact with security or airline employees to confirm their identity or on-board status. If airlines and government agencies share who is flying, airports could create a facial recognition system that allows travelers to fly through the airport without stopping.</p>

<h3><span style="text-decoration: underline;">Air Bridges</span>:</h3>

<p style="text-align: justify;">One idea is to create a so-called airlift between international destinations that agree to require passengers flying between them to undergo testing or other screening for symptoms of COVID-19. Consortium members hope that testing and pre-screening can reduce the risk of the virus spreading across borders and boost the demand for international travel. However, health officials noted that pre-flight testing has limitations as some travelers may test negative shortly after being infected and before the virus has had a chance to reproduce.</p>

<h3><span style="text-decoration: underline;">Mask Wearing</span>:</h3>

<p style="text-align: justify;">Three of the mass-broadcast cases in which more than one person was infected. Recent studies show these results during flights at the start of the pandemic when masking was not mandatory. On the other hand, on a flight from Dubai to Hong Kong, which carried 27 passengers infected with the coronavirus, universal masking was in place and only two people were infected. Regardless of your ticket type whether it''s affordable airline tickets or luxury ones, you’ll have to abide by these rules.</p>

<p style="text-align: justify;">One of them sat in a row with five people diagnosed with the virus upon arrival. The clues are extremely strong that the mass transmission events we know about really stopped happening after the airlines started introducing some form of cloaking. Wearing glasses or a face shield to cover your eyes is probably even more protective although face shields do not replace masks.</p>

<p style="text-align: justify;">Jumeirah Mosque is also a beautiful mosque in Dubai that accepts non-Muslim visitors. It will introduce you to the religious and cultural beliefs of the inhabitants of the UAE. It is one of the best spots that you must not skip in Dubai.</p>

<p style="text-align: justify;">Its observation deck provides you with magnificent Birdseye views, and you can experience the whole city from there. You can witness the whole desert on one side and the flowing Arabian Sea on the other. <p style="text-align: justify;">As we always share with you about every initiative which Pakistan international airline take for the betterment of the services and generate the handsome revenue to the economy of the homeland. <h3>1.	<span style="text-decoration: underline;">Kabuli Pulao</span>:</h3>

<p style="text-align: justify;">Kabuli Pulao is the famous dish of Kabul (capital of Afghanistan) North Western border of Pakistan. The combination of ingredients is (rice, ghee, onion, pure Pakistani dry spices, meat, saffron, all cloves, peanuts, and pistachios) make it perfect for the taste buds. On the final look, its smell is very gorgeous and yummy; presentation of serving is fabulous, when it offers at the lunch time.</p>

<h3>2.	<span style="text-decoration: underline;">Haleem</span>:</h3>

<p style="text-align: justify;">Haleem is very famous dish in dual cities, Lahore and Karachi equal. It’s cooked with the wheat, barley, Channa, the addition of meat, onion, mint leaves, dry chilies and at the top, garnish ginger, and green masala with chat masala and lemon juice. It is full of calories, which used in breakfast with Naan or during lunch too. The western visitors enjoyed this tasty dish by the heart.</p>

<h3>3.	<span style="text-decoration: underline;">Mutton Korma</span>:</h3>

<p style="text-align: justify;">Mutton korma is the pure cuisine of province Punjab. The Punjab cuisine is un-complete without it. It is mandatory. The city is a hip and dynamic metropolis that is famous for its cultural diversity, exciting city centre, amazing street art, unique coffee taste, fine dining options and neighborhoods that are packed with lush green parks and mountain ranges, where you can enjoy Australian nature. The coffee capital offers many activities and things to enjoy, including, theatre, sport, bars and fun festivals. The street was established in 1837, and many buildings date from the 19th century.</p>

<h3><span style="text-decoration: underline;">Adelaide Central Market</span>:</h3>

<p style="text-align: justify;">Central Market advertises itself as the "Adelaide Nutrition Center" for a reason: with 80 stalls under one roof, it is one of Australia''s largest fresh produce markets, offering a wide variety of products: as well as an excellent range of fruit and vegetable shops to choose from, and there are also delicious patisseries and cafes, exquisite cheeses, sweets, and popular, delicious meats. <h3><span style="text-decoration: underline;">Art Gallery</span>:</h3>

<p style="text-align: justify;">In the heart of Adelaide''s cultural district, the South Australian Art Gallery showcases one of Australia''s finest art collections. The collection covers all media, from sculpture, paintings, textiles, metalwork, and photography to ceramics, jewelry, and furniture. The Australian collection covers colonial times to the present day, including art from the indigenous peoples of the Torres Strait Island.</p>

<p style="text-align: justify;">European works highlight works from the Renaissance to the present day, while Asian exhibits include the only Muslim gallery devoted to Australia. Important works from North America are also on display, as well as evocative avant-garde sculptures.</p>

<h3><span style="text-decoration: underline;">Adelaide Central Market</span>:</h3>

<p style="text-align: justify;">A few steps west of Victoria Square, on the south side of Grote Street, Adelaide Central Market is a favorite shopping destination and one of the oldest markets in the world. It was founded in 1870; these colorful markets offer fresh fruit and vegetables, flowers, pastries, cheeses, and a vast array of multicultural culinary delights.</p>

<p style="text-align: justify;">After browsing the stalls packed with groceries, dine at one of the many cafes in the area or Asian restaurants in nearby Chinatown, and don''t forget to bring your shopping bags or baskets. Its white tent-like structure is an iconic landmark along the River Torrens.</p>

<p style="text-align: justify;">In addition to the large Festival Theater with 2,000 seats, there are several smaller theaters, a banquet hall, a light-filled gallery, and an amphitheater for concerts and recitals.</p>

<li>Bahrain</li>

The Boeing operation would add 2,000 more seats to the current operation of the national flagship carrier.</p>

<h3><span style="text-decoration: underline;">Details of Flights</span>!</h3>

<p style="text-align: justify;">There would be 10 PIA special flights flown between the 5th of July 2021 and the 18th of July 2021 to return 3,394 people from the UAE (United Arab Emirates) precisely. Furthermore, 6 flights will be flown from Doha from 6th to 18th of July 2021v with about 3 thousand passengers.</p>

<p style="text-align: justify;">In addition, between the 8th of July 2021 and the 11th of July 2021, two Boeing 777s PIA special flights with as many as 722 passengers will arrive.The minister said he hoped that his job would start in September, although the Ring Road project was a provincial issue.</p>

<p style="text-align: justify;">In response to a query, he remarked that the rise in commodity prices is not a public problem; unemployment is the true public worry. But during the PTI government, 1,6 million individuals were transferred to work overseas.</p>

</div>', N'<p><strong>Importance of Medina in Hadith</strong></p>
<p>&nbsp;</p>
<p>Narrated Anas:</p>
<p>The Prophet (ﷺ) said, "Medina is a sanctuary from that place to that. Its trees should not be cut and no heresy should be innovated nor any sin should be committed in it, and whoever innovates in it an heresy or commits sins (bad deeds), then he will incur the curse of Allah, the angels, and all the people." (See Hadith No. 409, Vol 9).</p>
<p>&nbsp;</p>
<p>Narrated Anas:</p>
<p>The Prophet (ﷺ) said, "Medina is a sanctuary from that place to that. Its trees should not be cut and no heresy should be innovated nor any sin should be committed in it, and whoever innovates in it an heresy or commits sins (bad deeds), then he will incur the curse of Allah, the angels, and all the people." (See Hadith No. 409, Vol 9).</p>
<p>&nbsp;</p>
<p>Narrated Abu Huraira:</p>
<p>The Prophet (ﷺ) said, "I have made Medina a sanctuary between its two (Harrat) mountains." The Prophet (ﷺ) went to the tribe of Bani Haritha and said (to them), "I see that you have gone out of the sanctuary," but looking around, he added, "No, you are inside the sanctuary."</p>
<p>&nbsp;</p>
<p>Narrated `Ali:</p>
<p>We have nothing except the Book of Allah and this written paper from the Prophet (wherein is written:) Medina is a sanctuary from the ''Air Mountain to such and such a place, and whoever innovates in it an heresy or commits a sin, or gives shelter to such an innovator in it will incur the curse of Allah, the angels, and all the people, none of his compulsory or optional good deeds of worship will be accepted. And the asylum (of protection) granted by any Muslim is to be secured (respected) by all the other Muslims; and whoever betrays a Muslim in this respect incurs the curse of Allah, the angels, and all the people, and none of his compulsory or optional good deeds of worship will be accepted, and whoever (freed slave) befriends (take as masters) other than his manumitters without their permission incurs the curse of Allah, the angels, and all the people, and none of his compulsory or optional good deeds of worship will be accepted.&nbsp;</p>

<p>&nbsp;</p>
<p>Narrated Abu Humaid:</p>
<p>We came with the Prophet (ﷺ) from Tabuk, and when we reached near Medina, the Prophet (ﷺ) said, "This is Tabah."</p>
<p>&nbsp;</p>
<p>&nbsp;</p>
<p>Narrated Abu Huraira:</p>
<p>If I saw deers grazing in Medina, I would not chase them, for Allah''s Messenger (ﷺ) said, "(Medina) is a sanctuary between its two mountains."</p>
<p><br /> </p>
<p>Narrated Abu Huraira:</p>
<p>&nbsp;</p>
<p>I heard Allah''s Messenger (ﷺ) saying, "The people will leave Medina in spite of the best state it will have, and none except the wild birds and the beasts of prey will live in it, and the last persons who will die will be two shepherds from the tribe of Muzaina, who will be driving their sheep towards Medina, but will find nobody in it, and when they reach the valley of Thaniyat-al-Wada`, they will fall down on their faces dead."</p>
<p>&nbsp;</p>
<p>&nbsp;</p>
<p>Narrated Sufyan b. Abu Zuhair:</p>
<p>I heard Allah''s Messenger (ﷺ) saying, "Yemen will be conquered and some people will migrate (from Medina) and will urge their families, and those who will obey them to migrate (to Yemen) although Medina will be better for them; if they but knew. Sham will also be conquered and some people will migrate (from Medina) and will urge their families and those who will obey them, to migrate (to Sham) although Medina will be better for them; if they but knew. ''Iraq will be conquered and some people will migrate (from Medina) and will urge their families and those who will obey them to migrate (to ''Iraq) although Medina will be better for them; if they but knew."</p>
<p>&nbsp;</p>
<p>&nbsp;</p>
<p>Narrated Abu Huraira:</p>
<p>Allah''s Messenger (ﷺ) said, "Verily, Belief returns and goes back to Medina as a snake returns and goes back to its hole (when in danger).</p>
<p>&nbsp;</p>
<p>Narrated Sa`d:</p>
<p>I heard the Prophet (ﷺ) saying, "None plots against the people of Medina but that he will be dissolved (destroyed) like the salt is dissolved in water."</p>
<p>&nbsp;</p>
<p>Narrated Usama:</p>
<p>Once the Prophet (ﷺ) stood at the top of a (looked out from upon one) castle amongst the castles (or the high buildings) of Medina and said, "Do you see what I see? (No doubt) I see the spots where afflictions will take place among your houses (and these afflictions will be) as numerous as the spots where raindrops fall."</p>
<p>&nbsp;</p>
<p>Narrated Abu Bakra:</p>
<p>The Prophet (ﷺ) said, "The terror caused by Al-Masih Ad-Dajjal will not enter Medina and at that time Medina will have seven gates and there will be two angels at each gate guarding them."</p>

<p>Narrated Abu Sa`id Al-Khudri:</p>
<p>Allah''s Messenger (ﷺ) told us a long narrative about Ad-Dajjal, and among the many things he mentioned, was his saying, "Ad-Dajjal will come and it will be forbidden for him to pass through the entrances of Medina. He will land in some of the salty barren areas (outside) Medina; on that day the best man or one of the best men will come up to him and say, ''I testify that you are the same Dajjal whose description was given to us by Allah''s Messenger (ﷺ) .'' Ad-Dajjal will say to the people, ''If I kill this man and bring him back to life again, will you doubt my claim?'' They will say, ''No.'' Then Ad-Dajjal will kill that man and bring him back to life. That man will say, ''Now I know your reality better than before.'' Ad-Dajjal will say, ''I want to kill him but I cannot.''</p>
<p>&nbsp;</p>
<p>Narrated Jabir:</p>
<p>A bedouin came to the Prophet (ﷺ) and gave a pledge of allegiance for embracing Islam. The next day he came with fever and said (to the Prophet (ﷺ) ), "Please cancel my pledge (of embracing Islam and of emigrating to Medina)." The Prophet (ﷺ) refused (that request) three times and said, "Medina is like a furnace, it expels out the impurities (bad persons) and selects the good ones and makes them perfect."</p>
<p>&nbsp;</p>
<p>Narrated Anas:</p>
<p>The Prophet (ﷺ) said, "O Allah! Bestow on Medina twice the blessings You bestowed on Mecca."</p>
<p>&nbsp;</p>
<p>&nbsp;</p>
<p>Narrated Anas:</p>
<p>Whenever the Prophet (ﷺ) returned from a journey and observed the walls of Medina, he would make his Mount go fast, and if he was on an animal (i.e. a horse), he would make it gallop because of his love for Medina.</p>
<p>&nbsp;</p>
<p>&nbsp;</p>
<p>Narrated Anas:</p>
<p>(The people of) Bani Salama intended to shift near the mosque (of the Prophet) but Allah''s Messenger (ﷺ) disliked to see Medina vacated and said, "O the people of Bani Salama! Don''t you think that you will be rewarded for your footsteps which you take towards the mosque?" So, they stayed at their old places.</p>
<p>&nbsp;</p>
<p>Narrated `Aisha:</p>
<p>When Allah''s Messenger (ﷺ) reached Medina, Abu Bakr and Bilal became ill. When Abu Bakr''s fever got worse, he would recite (this poetic verse): "Everybody is staying alive with his People, yet Death is nearer to him than His shoe laces." And Bilal, when his fever deserted him, would recite: "Would that I could stay overnight in A valley wherein I would be Surrounded by Idhkhir and Jalil (kinds of goodsmelling grass). Would that one day I could Drink the water of the Majanna, and Would that (The two mountains) Shama and Tafil would appear to me!" The Prophet (ﷺ) said, "O Allah! Curse Shaiba bin Rabi`a and `Utba bin Rabi`a and Umaiya bin Khalaf as they turned us out of our land to the land of epidemics." Allah''s Messenger (ﷺ) then said, "O Allah! Make us love Medina as we love Mecca or even more than that. O Allah! Give blessings in our Sa and our Mudd (measures symbolizing food) and make the climate of Medina suitable for us, and divert its fever towards Aljuhfa." Aisha added: When we reached Medina, it was the most unhealthy of Allah''s lands, and the valley of Bathan (the valley of Medina) used to flow with impure colored water.</p>
<p>&nbsp;</p>
<p>&nbsp;</p>
<p>Narrated Zaid bin Aslam from his father:</p>
<p>`Umar said, O Allah! Grant me martyrdom in Your cause, and let my death be in the city of Your Apostle."</p>

</div>', N'<p><span style="font-weight: 400;">Frankfurt is an important city of Germany and serves as a cultural capital. It is a global city which has attracted thousands of the visitors here. Many of the Pakistanis who live in Germany have also settled there, reaching city for the purpose of tourism is a good cause. Many of the cultures are present there. Most of the people are greeted and well received by others etc. It is a great hub of networking and all of the professional fields like banking, science and other type of intellectualism. It is situated across the river Main and is compared to Manhattan of America.</span></p>

<p><span style="font-weight: 400;">Reaching Germany requires Schengen Visa. This visa has allowed travelling access to all countries of Europe except for few. <h3><span style="text-decoration: underline;">Details of the flights</span>!</h3>

<h3><span style="text-decoration: underline;">Try To Do Small Activities Alone</span>:</h3>

<p style="text-align: justify;">Before embarking on a solo trip, you need to experience some critical things in your own town. For example, you can go to a local restaurant and start eating on your own. You should also be trying to do shopping alone so that you could get a hands-on experience of the activities that you are going to do during your trip.  In this way, you would not get worried while traveling abroad by Turkish Airline Booking.</p>

<h3><span style="text-decoration: underline;">Understand The Culture Of The Place You Are Entering</span>:</h3>

<p style="text-align: justify;">You might fall victim to some embarrassing misconceptions if you enter a new place without knowing its culture. Different countries have different rules for tourists, and you must need to know when to become formal.</p>

<p style="text-align: justify;">For example, if you are planning your next trip to UAE, then keep in mind that capturing the shots of government buildings might land you behind bars. Similarly, in Iran, it is not allowed to show affection in public places. Hence, it is always conducive to read the general guidelines before landing on a new country.</p>

<strong>Must Read:</strong> <a style="color:Purple;" href="https://blog.faremakers.com/Blog/2019/10/25/air-traveling-becomes-easy-with-faremakers   "><strong>Traveling Becomes Easy With Faremakers</strong></a>

<h3><span style="text-decoration: underline;">Know Where You Are Going</span>:</h3>

<p style="text-align: justify;">Make sure to check in advance the maps of the area where you are traveling. It is imperative to get in-depth knowhow of all the routes of your destination in order to avoid going astray. Furthermore, do not behave like a person who knows nothing. If people realize that you are a new traveler and you have no idea about the locations, then they might exploit your gentleness.</p>

<p style="text-align: justify;">Lastly, if possible, try to learn the language that is spoken by all the people. In this way, you will be able to communicate with foreigners conveniently.</p>

<h3><span style="text-decoration: underline;">Keep The Emergency Contact Info</span>:</h3>

<p style="text-align: justify;">In your home country, you can easily call the police in case of an emergency. But in a foreign country, you can only call the police if you know their contact number. Many countries have separate numbers for medical or crime emergencies. So, it is crucial to save the emergency contact numbers in your mobile or note them down in case your phone dies. Also, tell your family and friends how to reach you in an emergency.</p>

<h3><span style="text-decoration: underline;">Don’t Over-Pack</span>:</h3>

<p style="text-align: justify;">There is no need to stuff your bag with irrelevant things. Throughout the journey, you have to carry the bag by yourself, and overstuffing that bag will certainly exhaust your energies. To save space, you can plan different outfits using the same pieces. Furthermore, you should also be bringing only two pairs of shoes for the whole journey and shuffle them in time of need.</p>

<h3><span style="text-decoration: underline;">Don’t Run Out Of Cash</span>:</h3>

<p style="text-align: justify;">You cannot afford to start your journey with empty pockets. It is ok to sleep on a bench or ask strangers for help while traveling with your friends; however, while traveling solo by Turkish Airline Booking, you should certainly not ask for the free rides or sleeping beds. No one is behind your back, and going out of cash will be catastrophic for your enjoyment. In addition to this, you will also not be able to taste the food of your choice or buy your favorite clothes.</p>

<h3><span style="text-decoration: underline;">Conclusion</span>:</h3>

<p style="text-align: justify;">Diana Schoenbru, a renowned author, wrote in the Oct 4 edition of Washington Post that traveling alone for the first time was both thrilling and anxiety-inducing for her. She articulated her views in the paper to urge other people for solo traveling. Like her, we also urge you to do solo traveling at least once in your life. </div>', N'<p style="text-align: justify;">An island is a piece of sub-continental land that is surrounded by water. Whenever we think of the word “island,” the images of coconuts, palm trees, and blazing sapphire water come into our minds. When it comes to holiday destinations, there are so many beautiful islands to choose from. You can take a long walk on the beach, dip in the fresh water, or you can relax on the beach by soaking up the beautiful sun.</p>

<p style="text-align: justify;">Some islands are the summits of drowned volcanoes, while others are the scattered shards of continents. These scattered landing places offer a break in the form of abundant food and the occasional fruity cocktail. Here, we have come up with the most beautiful islands in the world you should immediately visit through <a href="https://www.faremakers.com/"><strong>Cheap Flight Tickets</strong></a>.</p>

<h3>1.	<span style="text-decoration: underline;">Jura, Scotland</span>:</h3>

<p style="text-align: justify;">The amazingly gorgeous island of Jura is one of the wildest places in Scotland. This long island is known for its pleasing whisky, soaring mountains, and the unparalleled serenity. It is located off the mainland’s west coast and has a local population of only 200 people. Surprisingly, the local population is outnumbered hugely by over 5,000 deer.</p>

<p style="text-align: justify;">Jura Island is a marvelous landscape that has drawn generations of adventurers. Plus, if you are obsessed with Scotch whisky, the famous Isle of Jura distillery is a place where you can find the single-malt made in the copper pots. Undoubtedly, Jura is a piece of heaven on earth.</p>

<h3>2.	<span style="text-decoration: underline;">St. Lucia, Latin America</span>:</h3>

<p style="text-align: justify;">This island depicts dark and poetic beauty. Unlike other Caribbean islands whose primary assets are their beaches, St. Lucia is full of topographic drama. The volcanic peaks and towering wedges rise more than 700 meters from the sea and provide an astonishing backdrop to the mesmerizing scenery. Here, you can explore coral reefs, coconut palms, quaint waterfalls, and much more.</p>

<p style="text-align: justify;">The Mrigot Bay and the Anse Chastanet Marine Park are some of the highlights where you will experience the French and Latin American influence.</p>

<strong>Must Read:</strong> <a style="color:Purple;" href="https://blog.faremakers.com/Blog/2019/12/14/things-to-know-before-going-to-bali-on-family-tour"><strong>Family Tour To Bali</strong></a>

<h3>3.	<span style="text-decoration: underline;">Comoros, Africa</span>:</h3>

<p style="text-align: justify;">If you are a tranquility lover, then you will feel extremely content at Comoros, one of the most beautiful islands in Eastern Africa. The volcanic islands in the Comoros region are called the “perfumed islands” because of the pleasing fragrance of their plant life. All the islands flaunt rich rainforests, pristine beaches, and an overwhelming blend of Arabian and Swahili culture.</p>

<p style="text-align: justify;">Mwali is the smallest island here. It is composed of a plateau that is about 1000 feet in elevation. The valleys of this island are fertile, and its hillsides are completely covered with forests. The freshness of Mwali and the hospitality of its natives will surely impress you.</p>

<h3>4.	<span style="text-decoration: underline;">Koh Tao, Thailand</span>:</h3>

<p style="text-align: justify;">Located in the Gulf of Thailand, this peaceful island has plenty of sheltered bays. Even though it is small in size, it is gaining popularity and going upscale gradually. The island is awash with soft sand and warm water. As soon as you dip your feet into the water, you will see a great variety of coral fishes rushing towards each other.
Apart from illustrating the sensational beauty, the island also acts as a hotspot for hikers and adventurers who valiantly hit the coastal jungle. While there are several Thai Islands to choose, Koh Tao will tick all the empty boxes!</p>

<h3>5.	<span style="text-decoration: underline;">Magnetic Island, Australia</span>:</h3>

<p style="text-align: justify;">Terming the Magnetic Island a precious gem of Australia’s unique wildlife would not be an exaggeration. It is situated offshore from the coastal city of Townsville and provides sanctuaries for animals form wild koalas. The island is famous not only for snorkeling but also fishing.</p>

<p style="text-align: justify;">There are more than 20 beaches along the coastline where people go simply to relax and soak up the sunshine. From the holiday homes and backpacker hotels to the luxury resort, the island offers a wide range of accommodation options that suit everyone’s travel style. People living in Turkey can book the online ticket of <a href="https://www.faremakers.com/turkish-airlines-flights"><strong>Turkish Airlines</strong></a> to reach Australia.</p>

<h3>6.	<span style="text-decoration: underline;">Paqueta, Brazil</span>:</h3>

<p style="text-align: justify;">Paqueta Island is only 70 minutes away from the center of the Brazilian city Rio de Janeiro. Since the cars are banned here, the only way to get around this island is either through foot or bike. Furthermore, you can also hire horses and carts if you are comfortable with them. Apart from the fabulous beaches, you will also observe a plethora of colonial buildings and the cute shops.</p>

<p style="text-align: justify;">The best time to visit Paqueta is during the festivals because you will witness colorful processions and fireworks on festivities. Swimming at the calm beaches and riding the bike along the streets are the most popular activities in this area.</p>

<h3><span style="text-decoration: underline;">Conclusion</span>:</h3>

</div>', N'<p style="text-align: justify;">Qatar is a small Muslim country located in the Persian Gulf. Each year, millions of travel enthusiasts come to Qatar and enjoy the stunning beauty of this country. In 2018, more than 1.8 million foreign visitors came to Qatar despite a blocked imposed by its four neighboring states. In addition to this, Qatar is hosting the Football World Cup 2022, and it is estimated that more than 4 million foreigners will come here through <a href="https://www.faremakers.com/   "><strong>Cheap Flight Tickets</strong></a> to watch world cup the matches.</p>

<p style="text-align: justify;">Doha is the capital of Qatar and is termed as the jewel in crown. Picturesque architecture and scenic views of Doha allure millions of people each year. It does not matter where you want to go in Doha, respecting local traditions and laws is imperative. Here, we have delineated all the essential things which must be followed if you want to seamlessly enjoy the splendor of Doha.</p>

<h3>1.	<span style="text-decoration: underline;">Weather</span>:</h3>

<p style="text-align: justify;">During the summer months, the atmosphere of Doha becomes extremely hot as temperatures generally go around 50. If you are coming from snowy or cold countries, then the extreme temperatures are way too much for you. Actually, Doha is cordoned off by deserts, and the scorching sun can exhaust you anytime. So, it would be conducive if you don’t come to Doha in summers.</p>

<h3>2.	<span style="text-decoration: underline;">Month Of Ramadan</span>:</h3>

<p style="text-align: justify;">In the month of Ramadan, drinking and eating in public places is strictly prohibited. Moreover, all the shops, supermarkets, and restaurants are closed during the day. It is because Qatari authorities have immense respect for the month of Ramadan. So, if you are a foreign tourist and are planning a visit to Doha by cheap flight tickets, then make sure that it is not the month of Ramadan. Otherwise, it would not be possible for you to fully enjoy the Clamor of Doha.</p>

<h3>3.	<span style="text-decoration: underline;">Dress Code</span>:</h3>

<p style="text-align: justify;">Qatar is an Islamic country, and most of the laws have been made as per the teachings of Shariah. In Doha, it is advised by the authorities to wear respectful clothes.  Even though Hijab is not mandatory in most of the places, however, it is always smarter to dress conservatively. Generally, foreign tourists don’t adhere to the customs of Qatar, and as a result, they end up being penalized by the officials. You can wear whatever you want indoors, but try to show some modesty in public places.</p>

<strong>Must Read:</strong> <a style="color:Purple;" href="https://blog.faremakers.com/Blog/2019/11/4/pia-increases-flights-to-middle-east-destinations   "><strong>PIA Increases Flights To Middle East Destinations</strong></a>

<h3>4.	<span style="text-decoration: underline;">Conveyance</span>:</h3>

<p style="text-align: justify;">There is no concept of public transport in Doha. You can go to one place to another either in your car or by taxi. Furthermore, you can also not get around on foot, given that Doha is not a pedestrian-friendly city. In the daytime, the streets depict a deafening silence, and so, it becomes even harder to find a taxi. So, always remember to book a taxi in advance before taking your foot out of the hotel.</p>

<h3>5.	<span style="text-decoration: underline;">Drinking Alcohol In Doha</span>:</h3>

<p style="text-align: justify;">Alcohol cannot be consumed publicly, and you can only buy it in the hotels. Moreover, it is also not allowed to bring alcohol into the country while traveling through cheap flight tickets. If the authorities find the drinks in your possession, then you would be strictly penalized.</p>

<p style="text-align: justify;">Furthermore, alcohol is also not available on the standard restaurants given that it is highly expensive. You can only find it in the lavish restaurants, and that is too in the inflated prices.</p>

<h3><span style="text-decoration: underline;">Conclusion</span>:</h3>

<p style="text-align: justify;">Doha is a captivating city, and you will explore a lot of eye-catchy things here. We truly hope that this article has guided you in knowing the veiled things of Doha. </div>', N'<p style="text-align: justify;">Pakistan Super League (PSL) is a t20 cricket league, founded on 9 September 2015 in Lahore. In the beginning, there were only five teams in the league. But now with the addition of Multan Sultans, the league comprises six teams. The season of the tournament runs between February and March every year. The matches of the league are played in a round-robin format. In this format, each team play against the other team and the top four teams then qualify for the semifinals.</p>

<p style="text-align: justify;">Until now, four seasons of the PSL have been held. The champions of the 2015 season were Islamabad United, whereas Peshawar Zalmi won the 2017 league. Islamabad United once again won the 2018 PSL Championship, and the current champions are Quetta Gladiators who won the PSL of 2019. The fifth season of the tournament is going to start in February, and it is the only season which will be held entirely in Pakistan.</p>

<h3>1.	<span style="text-decoration: underline;">PSL 2020</span>:</h3>

<p style="text-align: justify;">PSL 2020 is the fifth season of Pakistan Super League. The matches of PSL 2020 will take place between 20 February 2020 and 22 March 2020. Local and foreign players of six teams will be taking part in the matches that will be conducted in the stadiums of various Pakistani cities. It was all decided in 2019 when Prime Minister Imran Khan said that all the matches of the league would be held in Pakistan. He also said that the government would provide foolproof security for the international players and the officials.</p>

<h3>2.	<span style="text-decoration: underline;">Teams in the PSL 5</span>:</h3>

<p style="text-align: justify;">On 6 December 2019, players draft for the PSL 5 took place in Lahore. After the finalization of the draft, each team was allowed to take up to 8 players from their previous squad. Finally, Pakistan Cricket Board (PCB) released the retention players list with six teams that retained a total of 45 players from their previous squads. The teams taking part in the PSL 5 edition are:</p>
<ul>
<li>Islamabad United</li>
<li>Karachi Kings </li>
<li>Multan Sultans </li>
<li>Lahore Qalandars </li>
<li>Quetta Gladiators</li>
<li>Peshawar Zalmi</li>
</ul>

<h3>3.	<span style="text-decoration: underline;">Venues for the Tournament</span>:</h3>

<p style="text-align: justify;">It is for the first time that all the matches of the tournament are taking place in Pakistan. In the successive tournaments, some matches were played in Pakistan, while most of the matches were being hosted by UAE for the security reasons. In the PSL 2020, there are a total of 34 matches that will be played in four venues Multan, Lahore, Karachi, and Rawalpindi. The opening ceremony of the tournament will take place in Karachi, whereas the semifinal and final will take place in Lahore.</p>

The premier has directed all the pertinent authorities, including the police chiefs and chief secretaries to provide perfect security to the foreign officials.</p>

<h3>5.	<span style="text-decoration: underline;">PSL 5 Brings Everyone on the Same Page</span>:</h3>

<p style="text-align: justify;">The Pakistan Super League has brought the people of diverse professions on the same page. <p style="text-align: justify;">Kuwait, a booming gulf metropolis with towering skyscrapers, rich in culture and energised by modern wealth, is slowly but steadily overcoming the pandemic by conducting vigorous vaccination campaigns, research centres, public screenings, and enforcing other strict quarantine measures.</p>

<p style="text-align: justify;">If you''re planning a trip to Kuwait and looking for cheap flight tickets or any other, keep reading to learn more about the quarantine requirements and related SOPs.</p>

<p>
<strong>Must Read:</strong> <a style="color:Purple;" href="https://blog.faremakers.com/Blog/2021/3/22/latest-travel-advisory-of-kuwait-airways"><strong>Travel Advisory of Kuwait Airways</strong></a>
</p>

<h3><span style="text-decoration: underline;">People Who can Travel to Kuwait</span>!</h3>

<p style="text-align: justify;">On January 2, 2021, the Kuwait International Airport, as well as the land and sea boundaries, reopened and many people started looking for Kuwait Airways flight deals.But until further notice, only the following individuals are permitted to join Kuwait:</p>

<ul>
<li>Kuwaiti nationals</li>
<li>Kuwaiti nationals'' children, husbands, and wives; Kuwaiti nationals'' domestic workers Before leaving, they must register online at the official Belsalma website.</li>
<li>Diplomats, their relatives, and the domestic workers who accompany them.</li>
<li>Medical staff and their families are welcome.</li>
<li>Minors under the age of 18 who are unable to be vaccinated.</li>
<li>On their personal computers, they must install the Shlonik (available on both iOS and Android platforms) and Kuwait-Mosafer applications.</li>
</ul>

<p style="text-align: justify;">Visa-on-arrival services have been halted. Before departing, every passenger must register online at the official Kuwait Mosafer website.</p>

<h3><span style="text-decoration: underline;">Going from Kuwait and Coming Back</span>!</h3>

<p style="text-align: justify;">Kuwaiti patients who are sent abroad for medical care and then return must present a letter from the Kuwaiti Health Office in the country where they received the treatment.Returning Kuwaiti students enrolled in international universities must send a letter from the Kuwaiti culture office confirming their enrolment as well as a letter from the academic institution detailing the exam dates before opting for Kuwait Airways flight deals.</p>

<p style="text-align: justify;">Those who are unable to get vaccinated against the coronavirus due to medical reasons will be allowed to fly with the permission of the health ministry. At the same time, pregnant women who have not been inoculated but have valid certificates will travel abroad.</p>

<h3><span style="text-decoration: underline;">Quarantine Guidelines to Follow</span>!</h3>

<p style="text-align: justify;">According to the Kuwait Cabinet, travellers to Kuwait who have been immunized against Covid-19 or who have recovered from the disease during the last three months do not need to be quarantined upon arrival. Passengers flying into the country, on the other hand, must show proof of a negative PCR test within 72 hours of their arrival date. On May 22, the measure will take effect on all the Kuwait Airways <a href="https://www.faremakers.com/flight-promotion-deals"><strong>flight promotion deals</strong></a>.</p>

<p style="text-align: justify;">Direct commercial flights from Nepal, Pakistan, Bangladesh, and Sri Lanka have been banned indefinitely in Kuwait. Those who have lived in or transited through any of those four countries must spend at least 14 days outside of them before entering Kuwait. Passengers must book a hotel reservation that has been verified through the official Kuwait Mosafer app and the reservation must also be for seven days.</p>

<h3><span style="text-decoration: underline;">The above-mentioned rules don’t apply to the following</span>:</h3>

<li>Passengers who have received two COVID-19 vaccine doses at least two weeks before arrival and have a COVID-19 vaccination certificate.</li>
<li>Passengers who have received the first dose of the COVID-19 vaccine at least 5 weeks prior to arrival and have a COVID-19 vaccination certificate.</li>
<li>Passengers who have a COVID-19 recovery certificate as well as a vaccination certificate if the first vaccine dose was administered at least two weeks prior to arrival.</li>
<li>Kuwaiti nationals studying abroad who have a letter from the Kuwait Cultural Office as well as a letter from the university.</li>
<li>Unaccompanied children under the age of 18 Unaccompanied children under the age of 18.</li>', N'best-guidelines-to-know-before-travelling-to-kuwait-quarantine', N'Muhammad Ibrahim', NULL, 306, 1, CAST(N'2021-05-24T12:00:00.0000000+00:00' AS DateTimeOffset), CAST(N'2024-03-19T14:16:25.3966667+00:00' AS DateTimeOffset), CAST(N'2024-03-19T14:16:25.3966667+00:00' AS DateTimeOffset), 1)

one of the best countries for living. Many of the professional sectors are

focus in Ontario. 160 different language speakers can be found there.</span><br />

</div>', N'<p style="text-align: justify;">Pakistan is planning to launch a brand new airline to offer cheap flights for the people who love to travel. It will promote the country’s tourism greatly.</p>

<p style="text-align: justify;">Pakistan is one of the most beautiful countries in the whole world, and people from all over the world book <a href="https://www.faremakers.com/"><strong>cheap flights to Pakistan</strong></a> to witness its beauty. Now the country is planning to launch another airline that will be helping people with tourism. There are already many cheap airlines in the country, and the most popular one is Pakistan International Airlines. The name of the new airline is finalized to be North Air because it will be helping people to enjoy the northern beauty of the country.</p>

<h3><span style="text-decoration: underline;">The Licensing of the New Airline</span>!</h3>

<p style="text-align: justify;">The country''s CAA (Civil Aviation Authority) has already issued the TPRI (Tourism Promotion and Regional Integration) license to the new airline of the country. It’s important to note that the airline has initially announced that it will offer cheap flight tickets to Gwadar, Gilgit, Chitral, Skardu, and Islamabad.</p>

<p style="text-align: justify;">Keep in mind that these are some of the most popular destinations that people like to use in the whole country. Pakistanis and international tourists book airline flights of their choice to Pakistan to visit these places.</p>

The founder said that getting the license is one of the biggest milestones so far that the airline has achieved. Now it will be able to comply with all the requirements of the CAA of the country. It includes training capacity, technical staff, pilots, and the reviewing of the aircraft.</p>

<h3><span style="text-decoration: underline;">The Promotion of Tourism</span>!</h3>

<p style="text-align: justify;">The biggest goal of the airline is to improve tourism in the country that will also help the economy grow. Not only will this new airline improve national tourism, but it will also help Pakistan with international tourism.</p>

<h3><span style="text-decoration: underline;">Planes That Will be Used</span>!</h3>

<p style="text-align: justify;">The founder said that initially, the airline was planning to offer cheap flights with a couple of Bombardier Q400 planes. It is important to note that these aircraft are yet to be purchased, and North Air will be the first airline in the country to offer cheap online flights for these aircraft.</p>

<p style="text-align: justify;">These aircraft need short landing and take-off capabilities which is ideal for the northern areas. It works perfectly well for all the GB runways once aircraft can easily carry about 80 travellers and cover long distances.</p>

	<div class="custImageBlog">
