	    <p></p>


	</div>


</div>', N'<p style="text-align: justify;">Qatar has only one place for the planes, and that is the Hamad International Airport, Doha. Qatar Airways is the official airline of the country and operates from the same airport. From fresh and delicious meals to the convenient sitting arrangements, the airline offers everything to facilitate the passengers.</p>

<p style="text-align: justify;">However, like all other airlines, Qatar Airways also stays at the Doha airport for a short or long layover. For example, if you are from Pakistan, and want to go to London through <a href="https://www.faremakers.com/qatar-airways-flights   "><strong>Qatar Airways Flight Booking</strong></a>, then be ready for a stopover at the Hamad International Airport Doha. Since the plane remains in the air for many hours, it becomes necessary to refuel it and overhaul its machinery. Some layovers end in just a couple of hours, while on some occasions, the plane does not take off even after 3-4 days.</p>

<p style="text-align: justify;">Here, we are going to explain how you can plan and enjoy your stopover in Doha. We will focus on the places near the airport so that you could go there and make your stopover memorable. Let’s get started.</p>

<h3><span style="text-decoration: underline;">If You Have A Stopover Of 4-6 Hours</span>:</h3>

<p style="text-align: justify;">You probably cannot go far if your plane is going to stay at the airport only for 4-6 hours. However, 4-6 hours are enough to go to nearby towns and explore the intriguing places. Here are all the spots near the Doha airport where you can leisurely enjoy the short stopover.</p>

<h3>1.	<span style="text-decoration: underline;">Stroll Along Waterfront Croniche</span>:</h3>

<p style="text-align: justify;">You can go for a stroll along the croniche for witnessing the great views across the water. You will see that your fellow passengers will also be going there to experience the nice breeze coming off the Gulf. Besides, the skyscrapers of the West Bay will unquestionably fascinate your inner self.</p>

<h3>2.	<span style="text-decoration: underline;">Participate In The Exhibitions At Fire Station</span>:</h3>

<p style="text-align: justify;">Now, if you are thinking about observing something different, then head straight to the Fire station. It is an art center housed in an old building where you will observe interesting exhibitions open for the public.</p>

<strong>Must Read:</strong> <a style="color:Purple;" href="https://www.faremakers.com/flights/cheap-flights-from-lahore-to-london   "><strong>Lahore To London Flights</strong></a>

<h3><span style="text-decoration: underline;">If You Have A Layover Of 2-3 Days</span>:</h3>

<p style="text-align: justify;">What if you have a couple of days for the stopover? Here are the must-visit places in Doha in case you have enough time after availing a ticket from Qatar Airways flight booking.</p>

<h3>1.	<span style="text-decoration: underline;">Grab Something To Eat</span>:</h3>

<p style="text-align: justify;">Even though the airport does not offer a lot off food choices, there are meals that feature Arabic, Western, and Middle Eastern cuisine. You will find various food franchises including McDonald and Burger King from where you can taste the Qatari junk food.</p>

<h3>2.	<span style="text-decoration: underline;">Shop At The City Center</span>:</h3>

<p style="text-align: justify;">At the center of Doha, you will find a lavish Qatari market crowded with people of different races. From branded clothes and imported watches to the essential commodities, the market offers everything. Apart from the items, there are also topnotch cafes from where you can taste the traditional Qatari food. Lastly, also go to the Falcon Souq if you want to buy the living falcons.</p>

<h3>3.	<span style="text-decoration: underline;">Visit The Museum Of Islamic Arts</span>:</h3>

<p style="text-align: justify;">The Museum of Islamic Arts is a perfect place for history lovers. It is located on the one end of the seven-kilometer long Croniche and is surrounded by a park from the eastern and southern sides. Several ancient Islamic architectures are showcased here in geometric patterns. Moreover, you also can observe centuries-old Islamic art such as glittering jewels that were once belonged to the Shah Jahan, the creator of the Taj Mahal.</p>

<h3>4.	<span style="text-decoration: underline;">Head To Zubarah Fort</span>:</h3>

<p style="text-align: justify;">Zubarah Fort is the UNESCO world heritage site located on the north-west side of the Doha. It is a genuine treasure trove of the ancient Qatari history that pays tribute to a time when Qatar was nothing more than a desert. At the end of the fort, you will discover the shops of Bedouin barbecue along with a chance of camel riding.</p>

<h3>5.	<span style="text-decoration: underline;">Watch The Sand Dunes Of Khor Al Adaid</span>:</h3>

<p style="text-align: justify;">If you want a serene environment and skip the city hubbub, then you can calm your nerves by going to Al Adaid which is full of impeccable sand dunes. Since the journey from the airport to this desert will take around 5 hours, it is essential to bring water bottles and some eatables with you.</p>

<h3>6.	<span style="text-decoration: underline;">Enjoy The Night Life Of Doha</span>:</h3>

<p style="text-align: justify;">Doha’s nightlife is concerted around live music, venues, bars, and firecrackers. You will find plenty of architecturally ambitious hotels where you can play sports, watch movies, dance with the people, and at last, take a relaxing nap. Each night, music performances are carried out by popular bands that come to Doha just to entertain the visitors.</p>

<h3><span style="text-decoration: underline;">Conclusion</span>:</h3>

<p style="text-align: justify;">After resting at the hotel, you should come back to the airport to catch the Qatar Airways Flight because the fascinating places of Doha will not allow you to leave marvelous Qatar. We hope that after reading this piece, you will be able to spend your layover in Doha comfortably. Just create a passion for exploration in yourself, and Doha will answer all of your curiosities.</p>', N'how-to-plan-a-stopover-in-doha-qatar', N'Hamza Farooq', NULL, 820, 1, CAST(N'2019-11-23T14:00:00.0000000+00:00' AS DateTimeOffset), CAST(N'2024-03-19T14:16:25.3966667+00:00' AS DateTimeOffset), CAST(N'2024-03-19T14:16:25.3966667+00:00' AS DateTimeOffset), 1)

</div>', N'<p style="text-align: justify;">After exploring multiple countries or destinations, we decided to approach the Iran for the tourism because the travel industry is still budding and pay preference to approach all the corners of the universe and trying to remove the misconception’s thoughts regarding the Iran and other countries. We can understand that, the journey to the Iran is the fusion of the nerves and the excitement, but according to the visitors or the explorer (who already visited the Iran country) this country is quite safe and there is no danger for the tourists as the rumors are blowing in the air.</p>

<p style="text-align: justify;">Iran is the incredible and the amazed architecture country to travel through the <a href="https://www.faremakers.com/"><strong>Cheap Flights</strong></a> and it warmly welcomes by its friendliness hospitality and fascinating culture, stunning landscapes from respect local customs to haggling in the obvious places, tipping the etiquettes, majestic green mountains, desolate desert and Islands will make you speechless and lop off your all miss-concepts. Let’s visit the exponential country that’s grown up in the tourism industry, but before packing a few of the things you need to know about this destination.</p>

<h3><span style="text-decoration: underline;">Safe Place</span>:</h3>

<p style="text-align: justify;">One of the most important and most valuable points, Iran is a safe destination, but unfortunately, a few years before a lot of terrorists killed the peace of Iran. Now, we can say that Iran is totally safe from all types of disaster issues; travelers enjoy the trip without any hurdles and enjoy your trip with incredible memories. So, don’t feel scared, because it is not the terrific land, before you, many travelers go there and came back home country with the buckets of pleasant moments.</p>

<h3><span style="text-decoration: underline;">Money</span>:</h3>

<p style="text-align: justify;">Without money you do not enjoy your trip and now we are going to share with you some of the most shocking news regarding the modern era, Iran has not proper ATM branches, and this ATM just expects foreign credit cards. If you don’t have a proper case, so, maybe you out of luck, but it are not as the drawback as you think because you can bring with the maximum cash to enjoy the trip. Cash is the best option that makes us relax and comfortable. You should put your cash in the different portion of your luggage and then definitely, you feel calm as compared to the ATM transactions.</p>

<p>
<strong>Must Read:</strong> <a style="color:Purple;" href="https://blog.faremakers.com/Blog/2020/1/21/8-travel-adventures-for-the-year-2020"><strong>Travel Adventures For Year 2020</strong></a>
</p>

<h3><span style="text-decoration: underline;">Iran Currency</span>:</h3>

<p style="text-align: justify;">Iran currency has 2 names. First and the official name is Rial while the other one is Toman. Actually, Rial is the real name of Iran currency, in the Rial there are lots of zero added. Therefore, the locals call to currency as the Toman just by dropping the zero. The most concentrating point is the 1 Toman is equal to the 10 Rial and when the retailer or the shopkeeper asks you the Toman then you have to add the zero and pay him in the Rial.</p>

<h3><span style="text-decoration: underline;">Food</span>:</h3>

<p style="text-align: justify;">As we know, food is alluring point to the life and the cuisine is the symbol of the country. If you travel from Pakistan and other, you know the price of food is very high, but in Iran the food price very low, in just one dollar you can eat a lot of delicious food. Iranian food is different as compare to Asia and western estate. Few of the food names we will share with you.</p>
<ul>
<li>Falafel.</li>
<li>Persian Pizza.</li>
<li>Halim.</li>
<li>Aash-e Gandom.</li>
<li>Kebab.</li>
<li>Persian Saffron Ice Cream.</li>
<li>Bademjan.</li>
<li>Crunchy Fried Rice.</li>
</ul>
<h3><span style="text-decoration: underline;">Culture</span>:</h3>

<p style="text-align: justify;">Before going to anywhere, we are collecting necessaries points of its culture because if we don’t know about these important things so maybe these create serious hurdles in your trip. So, must know about it.</p>
<ul>
<li><p style="text-align: justify;">Women must wear hijab and loose fitting clothes all day when they want to visit the public places, In-short you must wear hijab in the public and holy spots.</p></li>
<li><p style="text-align: justify;">As we know Iran is a Muslim country. So, try to avoid shake hand with women and don’t show affection at the outdoor.</p></li>
<li><p style="text-align: justify;">Men also wear long pant and short shirt as well.</p></li>
<li><p style="text-align: justify;">You must have your original ID card and passport as well because some time government’s staff checks these things. That’s why must carry the copy of your documents when you are exploring the destination.</p></li>
<li><p style="text-align: justify;">If you are a female must cover your arms with your clothes because it’s not allowed in Iran to wear half sleeves shirts. You can ware pent as well but must cover thighs.</p></li>
<li><p style="text-align: justify;">If you men so must avoid wearing short pent as well because it''s not allowed.</p></li>

<h3><span style="text-decoration: underline;">Kilimanjaro</span>:</h3>

<p style="text-align: justify;">Covering an area of approximately 75,575 hectares, Kilimanjaro National Park protects the largest free-standing volcanic mass in the world and the tallest mountain in Africa, rising from 4,877 meters above the surrounding plains to 5,895 meters at the summit. With its snow-covered pinnacle, Mount Kilimanjaro is an entirely normal wonder remaining in seclusion over the encompassing fields ignoring the savannah.</p>

<p>
<strong>Must Read:</strong> <a style="color:Purple;" href="https://blog.faremakers.com/Blog/2020/12/29/oman-announces-to-open-its-land-air-and-sea-borders"><strong>Oman Announces To Open Its Land, Air, And Sea Borders</strong></a>
</p>

<p style="text-align: justify;">The iconic Kilimanjaro is the largest mountain in Africa, extremely popular with tourists and adventurers from around the world. Challenge yourself on the hike of a lifetime or explore beyond the mountains to see a world of fairy-tale nature, including the Big Five.</p>

<h3><span style="text-decoration: underline;">Cape Town</span>:</h3>

<p style="text-align: justify;">Hailed as one of the most spiritual places on the African continent, the unforgettable flat summit of the iconic Table Mountain in Cape Town, South Africa towers over a city that is teeming with attractions and the people who live there. To get to Table Mountain, visitors can take a scenic ride on a rotating cable car or, for the more adventurous, take a nature tour on one of the many trails that wind through its beautiful landscape.</p>

<p style="text-align: justify;">From the flat top, there is a great view of expansive Cape Town below, nearby Signal Hill, Lion''s Head, and the shimmering coastline. A must-see is Table Mountain National Park, which includes a region that includes Signal Hill, Lion''s Head, Table Mountain, Devil''s Peak, Twelve Apostles, and Orange Kloof.</p>

<h3><span style="text-decoration: underline;">Nairobi</span>:</h3>

<p style="text-align: justify;">Nairobi, the capital and largest city of Kenya, still evokes all the romances and adventures of those colorful colonial times. The city evolved from a modest railroad workers camp in 1899 to the capital of British East Africa in 1907. Today, Nairobi''s rich history and tribal culture come alive in its excellent museums.</p>

<p style="text-align: justify;">The Karen Blixen Museum is a huge hit - especially with fans of the book and movie Out of Africa who come to see where the Danish author of the same name worked on her coffee farm in the beautiful Ngong Hills. But even in such a bustling city, wildlife is a huge attraction. This cosmopolitan capital is one of the few cities in the world with a safari park within its borders.</p>

<h3><span style="text-decoration: underline;">Kigali</span>:</h3>

<p style="text-align: justify;">Kigali deserves more space on a tourist itinerary than a one-night stop to book the ultimate adventure: trekking to see mountain gorillas at Volcanoes National Park. Over the past two decades, Rwanda''s lush, hilly capital has developed into a bustling cosmopolitan place bustling with art, culture, and cuisine. Besides, the attractive urban center is one of the cleanest and safest cities in all of Africa.</p>

<p style="text-align: justify;">Regardless of how long you need to spend in Kigali, you should design at any rate a couple of hours to commit to the Kigali Genocide Memorial. The haunted museum explains the events that led to the Rwandan genocide in 1994 and presents a vital context for the next decades of peace and development in the country. INSERT [dbo].[Blogs] ([id], [mainTitle], [shortDescription], [description], [headerUrl], [author], [img], [visits], [isActive], [publishDate], [createdAt], [updatedAt], [blogTypeId]) VALUES (156, N'Dubai Airport - Inter Terminal Baggage Transfer Service', N'<div class="custShortContent">



	<div class="custImageBlog">


		<img src="https://firebasestorage.googleapis.com/v0/b/faremakers-connect.appspot.com/o/blogimages%2F84384293-13ae-404a-9556-5d95d5fd83bf.gif?alt=media&token=6782a4b9-e6ba-44f8-ab9f-3d0d0d2210c4" alt="inter-terminal-baggage-transfer-serive" title="inter-terminal-baggage-transfer-serive" class="picture" />

	</div>



	<div class="custTitle">


	    <p></p>


	</div>


</div>', N'<p style="text-align: justify;">Emirates has introduced <strong>Inter Terminal Baggage Transfer Service</strong> in Dubai to provide customer a better experience when transferring on separate tickets and on Other Airlines (OAL) with whom Emirates does not have an interline agreement with.</p>

<p style="text-align: justify;">EK to EK transfer Customers who have booked on Emirates sectors only can be through checked in from origin destination all the way to the final destination. All <a href="https://www.faremakers.com/emirates-airline-flights"><strong>Emirates airlines flights</strong></a> arrive and depart from Dubai International Airport Terminal 3.</p>

<h3><span style="text-decoration: underline;">EK to OAL Transfer</span>:</h3>

<p style="text-align: justify;">In Dubai Airport, other airlines operate from Terminal J. and 2. Customers who are booked on EK and onwards to another airline will arrive in Terminal 3 and then depart from different terminal.</p>

<p style="text-align: justify;">The acceptance of customers depends on the type of ticket.</p>

<h3>1. <span style="text-decoration: underline;">Through Journey</span>:</h3>

<p style="text-align: justify;">Customer''s whose entire journey is booked on a single ticket (EK is the delivering carrier and the receiving carrier is OAL) can be through checked and the baggage through tagged. The connection in Dubai must be within 24 hours. Boarding pass will be issued from point of origin and customer can proceed directly to the OAL terminal.</p>

<h3>2. <span style="text-decoration: underline;">Separate Tickets</span>:</h3>

<p style="text-align: justify;">Customers holding separate tickets have the option to avail the <strong>Emirates Inter Terminal Baggage Transfer Service</strong> when transferring in Dubai.</p>

<p style="text-align: justify;"><strong>Customers who are not eligible to enter Dubai or do not want to clear customs, immigration and re-check in with the OAL can request EK to arrange the transfer of bags to OAL.</strong></p>
<ul>
<li><p style="text-align: justify;">Upon arrival at Terminal 3, must proceed to the nearest EK Connections area to avail the airside inter-terminal bus service. The bus would drop off the customer to Terminal 1 or Terminal 2 Connections area.</p></li>
<li><p style="text-align: justify;">Customer needs to approach the OAL Connections desk to check-in for the respective flight and request for the Inter Terminal Baggage Transfer Service.</p></li>
<li><p style="text-align: justify;">Customer must pay for the service for the EMD to be issued along with the boarding pass.</p></li>
<li><p style="text-align: justify;">After payment, customer will be guided to the departure gate.</p></li>
</ul>
<p style="text-align: justify;">Customers who do not want to avail the Inter Terminal Baggage Transfer Service must meet UAE entry requirements and proceed to Dubai arrivals, clear immigration, collect the checked baggage from the arrival baggage carousel and make their own arrangements to proceed to the OAL check-in desk at Terminal 1 or Terminal 2.</p>

<h3><span style="text-decoration: underline;">OAL to EK Transfer (Interline Transfer)</span>:</h3>

<p style="text-align: justify;">These bookings involve OAL as the delivering carrier and customers will arrive in Terminal 1 or 2 and have an onwards flight with EK at Terminal 3. The customer may be through checked in to the final destination depending on whether the customer holds a single ticket and if the airlines involved have an interline agreement.</p>

<h3>1. <span style="text-decoration: underline;">Through Journey(Single Ticket)</span>:</h3>

<p style="text-align: justify;">When entire journey is on single ticket (first sector is on an OAL) and customer has been through checked-in on EK, customers do not need to collect their bags when transferring in Dubai. The customer may proceed directly from Ti/T2 via the inter-terminal bus to Terminal 3, from where EK operates and board the flight.</p>

<h3>2. <span style="text-decoration: underline;">Separate Tickets</span>:</h3>

<p style="text-align: justify;">When customers are holding separate tickets and airlines involved do not have interline agreement then customer will only be checked in and bags tagged only until Dubai.</p>

<p style="text-align: justify;">Customers have the option to avail the <strong>Emirates Inter Terminal Baggage Transfer Service</strong>.</p>

<p style="text-align: justify;"><strong>Customers who are not eligible to enter Dubai or do not want to clear customs, immigration and re-check in with EK can request EK to arrange the transfer of bags from Ti/T2 to T3.</strong></p>
<ul>
<li><p style="text-align: justify;">Upon arrival at Terminal 1/2, the customer should proceed to the nearest OAL Connections area to avail the airside inter-terminal bus service to Terminal 3. The bus would drop off the customer at the Terminal 3 Connections area.</p></li>
<li><p style="text-align: justify;">Customer must approach the EK Connections desk to check-in for the respective flight and request for the Inter Terminal Baggage Transfer Service.</p></li>
<li><p style="text-align: justify;">Customer must pay for the service for the EMD to be issued along with the boarding pass.</p></li>
<li><p style="text-align: justify;">After payment, customer will be guided to the departure gate.</p></li>
</ul>
<p style="text-align: justify;">Customers not availing the Emirates Inter Terminal Baggage Transfer Service, can proceed to Dubai Arrivals, clear immigration, collect the checked baggage from the arrival baggage carousel and make their own arrangements to proceed to Terminal 3 and check-in with EK.</p>

<p style="text-align: justify;">Should you have queries or require further information on this release, please contact your local sales team. We thank you for your continued support.</p>

<p style="text-align: justify;">Kindly disseminate to all concerned accordingly.</p>

<p style="text-align: justify;"><strong>Source: Emirates</strong></p>', N'dubai-airport-inter-terminal-baggage-transfer-service', N'Admin', NULL, 915, 1, CAST(N'2020-09-21T13:00:00.0000000+00:00' AS DateTimeOffset), CAST(N'2024-03-19T14:16:25.3966667+00:00' AS DateTimeOffset), CAST(N'2024-03-19T14:16:25.3966667+00:00' AS DateTimeOffset), 1)
GO

<p style="text-align: justify;">Consistent delivery of services is pivotal to maintain the flow of people to famous tourist destinations. <p style="text-align: justify;">We know that the hotels in Pakistan mislead the people by boasting the so-called quality of their services. They try to woo the tourists by claiming that they have all the amenities, but in reality, they lack even the essential services. <h3>4.	<span style="text-decoration: underline;">Province Empowerment</span>:</h3>

<p style="text-align: justify;">Instead of handling all the tourism-related stuff on its own, the federal government should devolve the powers to the pertinent provinces. This aspect had become more crucial after the passage of the 18th amendment. The federal government should allocate the funds for the provinces and ask their officials to leave no stone unturned to facilitate the local as well as foreign tourists.</p>

<p style="text-align: justify;">Moreover, it is the responsibility of provincial governments to pay special heed to the tourism infrastructure of their provinces. Not only will it sustain economic growth, but it will also lessen the trust deficit among the people.</p>

<h3>5.	<span style="text-decoration: underline;">Promoting The Public-Private Partnership</span>:</h3>

<p style="text-align: justify;">The services of PPP (Public-Private Partnerships) can also be utilized to enhance the capacity of the tourism sector. With the phenomenon of PPP, it has become easier for the government to shift the load to the private sector. The government devises the policy framework and then asks the private owners to follow the prescribed procedures. For many years, the PPP framework has been immensely effective in <a href="https://www.faremakers.com/flight-promotion-deals"><strong>Airline Deals</strong></a> and hotel infrastructure. So, this potential can also be tapped in the tourism sector in order to create a sustainable tourism environment.</p>

<p style="text-align: justify;">For Pakistan, earning the status of the “Best Tourism Destination” is a landmark achievement, but the real test lies in preserving that status. <p style="text-align: justify;">In turn, these public and private projects explore new spaces and forms. While restaurants and eateries remain the main attraction, Pakistan has to offer to international and local audiences a list of some of the finest architecture in Pakistan.</p>

<h3><span style="text-decoration: underline;">Mohatta Palace</span>:</h3>

<p style="text-align: justify;">The blend of pink Jodhpur stone and yellow Gizri stone makes Mohatta Palace one of Karachi''s kind structures. Mohatt Palace is also one of the oldest buildings in the city. The stylish style of Indo-Pak recovery engineering was worked by Shivratan Chandraratan Mohatta, a Rajithani money manager in 1927.</p>

<p style="text-align: justify;">After the split, Quaid-e-Azam''s sister Fatima Jinnah moved here and, in 1995, was turned into a museum by the Sindh government.</p>

<h3><span style="text-decoration: underline;">Faisal Mosque</span>:</h3>

<p style="text-align: justify;">When a design by Turkish architect Vedata Dalokaya was selected for the Faisal Mosque, many raised an eyebrow. The mosque is named after Faisal bin Abdul-Aziz, the Saudi king who suggested creating a national mosque in Pakistan and largely financed its construction. The 5,000 square meter prayer hall is an octagonal concrete structure inspired by traditional Bedouin tents and can accommodate 100,000 worshipers. Four 88-meter-high minarets surround it in an ideal one-to-one ratio with the base.</p>

<p style="text-align: justify;">They are designed as the sides of an imaginary cube in honor of the sacred, cubic Kaaba at the center of Mecca''s most important mosque. If you are in Lahore, you can easily take Lahore to Islamabad flights to visit this marvelous place.</p>

<h3><span style="text-decoration: underline;">Badshahi Mosque</span>:</h3>

<p style="text-align: justify;">The majestic Badshahi Mosque in Lahore is one of the most beautiful holy places for Muslims. It was built in 1673, and the largest globally for over 300 years, until the completion of the Faisal Mosque in 1986. Its enormous courtyard, which covers 26,000 square meters, remains the largest globally and can accommodate up to 95,000 worshipers.</p>

<p style="text-align: justify;">Travelers greeted into the mosque through the grand entrance gate will discover that the building''s interior is no less breathtaking.Its cornucopia of arches, stuccoes, and frescoes that never cease to amaze.</p>

<h3><span style="text-decoration: underline;">Rohtas Fort</span>:</h3>

<p style="text-align: justify;">This magnificent fort is located near Jhelum. Fort Rohtas is also known as Qila Rohtas. Fort Rohtas is a former fort that consists of around twelve gates in total. There are other things inside this fort-like museum, mosque, temple, Phansi Ghat, Rani Mahal, and Langar Khan gates. There are also three water wells in the fort. Fort Rohtas is believed to be one of the largest forts in the subcontinent. The architecture of this place is a combination of Hindu and Afghan architecture.</p>

<p style="text-align: justify;">The walls of Rohtas Fortress are high and strong and made of limestone and sandstone. You can choose your air travel from a range of air travel companies in Pakistan for your domestic travel.</p>

<h3><span style="text-decoration: underline;">Derawar Fort</span>:</h3>

<p style="text-align: justify;">A visit to Derawar Fort requires three to four hours of travel in a four-wheeled vehicle. But those who have a soft spot for military structures will not regret the trip. The embankments rise about 30 meters above the ground, and the fort has an impressive circumference of 1.5 kilometers. Visiting the inside of the fort requires special permission from the local authorities, and it may not be worth the trouble of going through such a process: the imposing bastions are, in fact, the real highlight of this striking monument.</p>

<p style="text-align: justify;">However, while on-site, visitors can also admire the nearby mosque, an almost replica of the Moti Mosque next to Delhi''s Red Fort.</p>

<h3><span style="text-decoration: underline;">Minar-e-Pakistan</span>:</h3>

<p style="text-align: justify;">On March 23, 1940, the All-India Muslim League adopted a resolution that was a decisive step towards Pakistan''s creation. The tower rests on a raised base in a five-pointed star, consisting of four platforms. The stones used to build each platform are gradually refined from the bottom up to mark the difficult development but the ultimate success of the Pakistan Movement for Independence.</p>

<p style="text-align: justify;">If you have visited Minar-e-Pakistan, you must be looking forward to visiting other architectural places in Pakistan.</p>

<h3><span style="text-decoration: underline;">Mohenjo Daro</span>:</h3>

<p style="text-align: justify;">Mohenjo-Daro is probably the most attractive historical place in Pakistan, which is also world-famous. It is located in the Larkana district, Sindh. It is located on the shore of the mighty Indus stream, which makes it breathtaking. This place''s archaeological remains take us back to antiquity 3000 BC, making it one of the world''s earliest major cities. These beautiful ruins are about 5,000 years old. The fact that this place is so ancient makes it even more amazing.</p>

<h3><span style="text-decoration: underline;">Saint Patrick Cathedral</span>:</h3>

<p style="text-align: justify;">St. Patrick''s Day is one of the most important churches in Pakistan. It is located near the historic Empress Market in Karachi. The cathedral is built in neo-gothic architecture, and it can simultaneously accommodate at least 1,500 faithful people.</p>

<p style="text-align: justify;">The architect, Fr. Karl Wagner SJ, built up the church building plan, and the development was managed by the lay siblings George Kluver SJ and Herman Lau SJ.</p>

</div>', N'<p style="text-align: justify;">Founded on 29 October 1946, <a href="https://www.faremakers.com/pakistan-international-airlines-flights   "><strong>PIA - Pakistan International Airlines</strong></a> is the national flag carrier of Pakistan which operates in more than 16 countries across Asia, Europe, Middle East, and North America. In addition, PIA also serves 18 domestic and 25 international destinations with more than 35 aircraft in its fleet. The primary hub of the PIA is Jinnah International Airport Karachi; however, Allama Iqbal International Airport Lahore and Islamabad International Airport are also considered as the main hubs of the airline. The leading aircraft of PIA include ATR 42-500, Boeing 777-200ER, Boeing 777-200LR, and Boeing 777-300ER.</p>

<p style="text-align: justify;">Convenience for the passengers is the hallmark of the Pakistan International Airlines. From accommodation and traveling advancements to the amenities of meals, PIA offers all the things that will undoubtedly make your journey luxurious. The baggage policy of PIA is the testimony to this argument. To facilitate the consumers, PIA charges a minuscule amount for any kind of baggage and paraphernalia. However, considering the revamp in the quality of the services, PIA has decided to increase the fees for additional baggage.</p>

<p style="text-align: justify;">In this piece, we have tried to inform the readers about the previous and new charges of PIA for additional baggage.  Read on to get an in-depth knowledge of the new PIA baggage policy.</p>

<h3><span style="text-decoration: underline;">Charges For Additional Luggage Before 24 Nov 2019</span>:</h3>

<p style="text-align: justify;">PIA has a variety of baggage services for Business and Economy class passengers. If you are traveling in Economy class, then you can carry the baggage of 7 kg max on both domestic and international flights. Similarly, Business class passengers can carry a maximum of 12 kg for both domestic and international flights. However, if someone wants to transfer additional luggage, then he/she will have to pay additional charges for the baggage. The previous fee of PIA for extra luggage is as follow:</p>
<ul>
<li>Rs100/KG for all the domestic flights.</li>
<li>20 KG in Rs5000 for Economy Class.</li>
<li>25 KG in Rs5000 for Executive Economy Class.</li>
<li>30 KG in Rs5000 for Business Class.</li>
</ul>

<h3><span style="text-decoration: underline;">Charges After 24 Nov 2019</span>:</h3>

<p style="text-align: justify;">On Nov 24, 2019, PIA-Pakistan International Airlines raised its fees for additional baggage. The spokesperson of PIA said that the commuters would now have to pay Rs5800 on additional luggage amounting to more than 10 kilograms on all the domestic and international flights. The raised charges for the additional luggage are as follow:</p>
<ul>
<li>Rs5800 per 10 Kg for all domestic and international flights.</li>
<li>Rs250 per Kg for all the domestic flights.</li>
<li>Rs2500 per Kg from Karachi to Dubai bound flights.</li>
<li>Rs800 per kg from Karachi to Jeddah bound flights.</li>
<li>Rs 3500 per kg from Karachi to London bound flights.</li>
<li>Rs25000 per 27 Kg from Karachi to Toronto bound flights.</li>
</ul>
<p style="text-align: justify;">PIA officials have said that the decision to increase the charges has been taken in light of the taxes being imposed on the airline by foreign countries. However, the officials have clarified that once the taxes are withdrawn, the charges will revert to their original prices.</p>

<h3><span style="text-decoration: underline;">Conclusion</span>:</h3>

<p style="text-align: justify;">It would be tough for most of the people to sustain the hiked charges. Therefore, the sane approach would be to transfer as less luggage as possible while going to a foreign country. It would not only save your money but would also reduce the burden on your shoulders. We suggest you book the air ticket from <a href="https://www.faremakers.com/   "><strong>faremakers.com</strong></a> to avail the discounts on the additional luggage charges of PIA.</p>', N'pia-has-raised-its-fees-for-additional-baggage', N'Hamza Farooq', NULL, 771, 1, CAST(N'2019-11-25T14:00:00.0000000+00:00' AS DateTimeOffset), CAST(N'2024-03-19T14:16:25.3966667+00:00' AS DateTimeOffset), CAST(N'2024-03-19T14:16:25.3966667+00:00' AS DateTimeOffset), 1)

If you ever come to Chicago through <a href="https://www.faremakers.com/kuwait-airways-flights"><strong>Kuwait Airways</strong></a>, never forget to experience the charm of these places.</p>

<h3><span style="text-decoration: underline;">Navy Pier</span>:</h3>

<p style="text-align: justify;">Opened in 1916 as a recreational area, Navy Pier is now one of the most attractive tourist destinations in Chicago. This fascinating place is made up of over 50 acres of parks, gardens, shops, concert venues, and restaurants. The exciting carousel and the 150 ft Ferris wheel impressively embellish this place. Amazingly, visitors can indulge in various amusing activities, including watching the theatre performances and 3D movies and visiting the botanical gardens. Surprisingly, there is also a museum here where you can go to observe the historical artifacts. Last but not least, Navy Pier hosts a number of famous festivals to provide the people with unending entertainment.</p>

<h3><span style="text-decoration: underline;">Riverwalk</span>:</h3>

<p style="text-align: justify;">It is imperative to take a stroll along the Riverwalk if you want to experience the breathtaking sightseeing Chicago. Witnessing the stunning skyline of the city is sure to leave you spellbound. The sparkling lights next to the Chicago River are nothing but the gems of heaven. In addition, you can also accomplish your cuisine fantasies by going to any of the nearby prestigious hotels or bars. These bars are famous for offering tasty local as well as exotic dishes. </p>

<h3><span style="text-decoration: underline;">Art Institute of Chicago</span>:</h3>

<p style="text-align: justify;">The Art Institute of Chicago is the city’s most renowned cultural institution, which takes pride in housing over 300,000 artworks and designs. There is also an indoor restaurant here that offers scrumptious Italian food to the guests. This art institute gives you an amazing opportunity to explore the acclaimed classic paintings of various famous artists, including Georges Seurat and Grant Wood. Surprisingly, there is also a Modern Wing in the institute where you can have a glimpse over the contemporary collections.</p>

<h3><span style="text-decoration: underline;">Buckingham Fountain</span>:</h3>

<p style="text-align: justify;">Buckingham Fountain is the focal point of the famous Grant Park. It is one of the largest and the most beautiful one in the world. It was built in 1927 in the typical Art Deco style. The central fountain is engulfed by four seashores, each representing the four bordering states of Lake Michigan. The real charm of the fountain can be observed between 8 am to 11 pm as it shoots 15,000 gallons of water through dozens of nozzles, thereby creating a mesmerizing display. However, if you are here in the evening, the impressive night display will certainly overwhelm you.</p>

</div>', N'<p style="text-align: justify;">If you’re planning to perform Hajj or Umrah this year by opting for the best Hajj and Umrah packages, then here’s what you need to know.</p>

<p style="text-align: justify;">As is generally known, one of the five pillars of Islam is the Hajj Pilgrimage. Before the global pandemic, millions of Muslims used to book Cheap Saudi Arabian Airlines or any other airline to visit Mecca from all across the globe and conduct certain devotional practices at the Great Mosque of Mecca, Masjid Al-Haram.</p>

<p style="text-align: justify;">Besides that, the act of devotion, however, also the Umrah, also known as the minor Hajj, also requires Muslims to enter the Holy City and perform rites. You can still find the <strong>best Hajj and Umrah packages</strong> even after the pandemic, but the landscape of performing the practices will be different from earlier.</p>

<h3><span style="text-decoration: underline;">Vaccination Requirements and Guidelines for Umrah in 2021</span>!</h3>

<p style="text-align: justify;">If you plan to opt for the <a href="https://www.faremakers.com/umrah-packages"><strong>best Umrah package 2021</strong></a>, there are specific rules and regulations because of the COVID-19 that you must follow. The Saudi Ministry of Umrah and Hajj has declared that the Kingdom of Saudi Arabia would let only those people enter the Prophet''s Mosque in Medina and Masjid Al-Haram in Mecca. They have been fully recovered from coronavirus vaccinated against it.</p>

<p style="text-align: justify;">The vaccination status is registered initially on the smartphone application for COVID-19 in the Kingdom of Saudi Arabia. Two of the recommended apps are Tawakkalna and Eatmarna for Umrah. These two applications are the only official portals permitted to grant legitimate permissions. So, if you are going to book affordable Saudi Arabian Airlines flights, you will need to use these applications. Moreover, the public has been advised that dodgy websites should be avoided and that fake forms should be completed.</p>

<h3><span style="text-decoration: underline;">Rules of Umrah Pilgrims</span>!</h3>

<p style="text-align: justify;">A series of rules have been issued for this year''s application of Umrah, and you’ll need to follow all of them if you’re looking for the most suitable Umrah package 2021. There are also two main masjids, which no children may access.</p>

<p style="text-align: justify;">Each passenger has to verify that they have the correct authorization to visit the masjids while constantly trying to preserve social distance. In addition, in the core region around Makkah, unlicensed cars are not allowed, and worshipers must arrive in time. It’s important to note if you are booking Saudi Arabian Airline tickets that you’ll need to face the punishment of 1000 Saudi Riyals if you violate any of the following rules.</p>

<ul>
<p style="text-align: justify;"><li>At least six hours before Umrah, all the pilgrims with the best 2021 Umrah packages must attend a health care center at Makkah. The authorities will therefore be able to verify the state of their immunization by kind of permitted vaccinations.</li></p>
<p style="text-align: justify;"><li>Wristbands will be given to all the people, and they will be compelled to wear them all the time. They are subsequently delivered to the Al-Shubaikha collection center, where the wristbands are required to check data and permissions.</li></p>
<p style="text-align: justify;"><li>All pilgrims with Saudi Arabian Airlines online booking or with any other airline must adhere carefully to the date and hour of Umrah.</li></p>
</ul>

<h3><span style="text-decoration: underline;">Vaccination Requirements and Guidelines for Hajj in 2021</span>!</h3>

<p style="text-align: justify;">This year''s Hajj will be held with only 60,000 pilgrims worldwide, and the authorities have verified this news. So, if you are one of the lucky ones and successfully obtained the best Hajj package in 2021, then you’ll need to follow specific requirements. Moreover, there will be 15,000 Saudi nationals and 45,000 international pilgrims who will perform Hajj. The reduced number is just because of the COVID-19 pandemic, and the traditional quantity of millions of people is regretfully banned for the Hajj 2021.</p>

<p>
<strong>Must Read:</strong> <a style="color:Purple;" href="https://blog.faremakers.com/Blog/2020/11/3/essential-things-you-should-know-for-performing-umrah"><strong>Essential Things You Should Know For Performing Umrah</strong></a>
</p>

<p style="text-align: justify;">It will only be permitted to conduct Hajj this year if persons aged 18 to 65 years who had at least one dose of Covid-19 vaccination at the earliest 14 days are clear of chronic illness. Those above 65 years old are banned from doing Hajj this year to protect their health during the continuing epidemic. The Ministry of Hajj shares the guidelines and regulations in Saudi Arabia.</p>

<p style="text-align: justify;">The ministry has also mentioned that all the pilgrims looking for Saudi Arabian Airlines online flights must be vaccinated entirely concerning the Hajj trip to Saudi Arabia. The criteria for vaccination are as follows according to Saudi Arabia''s entrance rules:</p>

<ul>
<li>Pfizer BioNTechtwo dosages</li>
<li>Oxford AstraZeneca two doses</li>
<li>Two Modern dosages</li>
<li>One Johnson and Johnson dosage</li>
</ul>

<p style="text-align: justify;">Time duration of your vaccination dosage (the last one in the case where you need to get two doses or just the first dose in the case of Johnson) must be less than or equals to 14 days. On then you’ll be able to book cheap Saudi Arabian Airline tickets.</p>

<h3><span style="text-decoration: underline;">Other Requirements</span>!</h3>

This bridge combined the two independent cities of the NYC that is the Brooklyn and the Manhattan. The main purpose to build this bridge is to avoid the problem of the river crossing by the boat because in the winter season, it will be frozen. 	<div class="custImageBlog">


		<img src="https://firebasestorage.googleapis.com/v0/b/faremakers-connect.appspot.com/o/blogimages%2F84384293-13ae-404a-9556-5d95d5fd83bf.gif?alt=media&token=6782a4b9-e6ba-44f8-ab9f-3d0d0d2210c4" alt="How-to-perform-UMRAH" title="How-to-perform-UMRAH" class="picture" />

	</div>


</div>', N'<p style="text-align: justify;">We bring best Umrah packages in Lahore to all the Muslims and our many customers who go first time on Umrah, for that customers Faremakers is here to tell you about the complete way of Umrah performance. With the providing of latest Umrah deals, cheap air tickets, hotel/ cab booking services, we aware our clients from all the topics, which is necessary.
“UMRAH is the kind of worship, in which all around the world Muslim come to Makah &amp; Medina to visit Holy places. It can perform any time in year except Hajj days.”
• Rituals of UMRAH:
It has four comprises to perform Umrah. When we perform all 4 rituals then Umrah is completed.
1. Ihram
2. Tawaaf
3. Sa’ye
4. Qasar / Hala
1: Ihram:
Firstly Niyyah of Umrah and recite the Talbiya before reach Miqat.
• Restriction in Ihram:
1. Cutting Nails
2. Hair cutting or remove extra hair from any part of the body.
3. Use of any fragrance on the body or on the beard.
4. Stitched Clothing.
5. Sandals and flip flops must not be stitched either and should allow the ankle and back of feet to be exposed.
6. Covering Face and Head.
7. Hunting of animals even of lice.
8. Sexual activity.
• Procedure of Putt-up Ihram:
1. Take a Ghusal (Bath) with pure water to the intention of Ihram.
2. Wear Ihram cloth (white color fabric).
3. Offer 2 Rakat of Nafal by cover your head.
4. Uncover your head declare your intention / Niyyah with the verse:</p>
<p style="text-align: center;"><strong>اَللَّهُمَّ اِنِّيْ اُرِيْدُ الْعُمْرَةَ فَيَسِّرْهَا لِيْ وَ تَقَبَّلْهَا مِنِّيْ</strong></p>
5. After leaving home start reciting Dua’a constantly. It is compulsory to recite Talbiya loudly at once that is written down.
<p style="text-align: center;"><strong>بِسْمِ اللَّهِ تَوَكَّلْتُ عَلَى اللَّهِ، لاَ حَوْلَ وَلاَ قُوَّةَ إِلاَّ بِاللَّهِ</strong></p>
6. When you enter in Masjid Al Haram: Recite Darud e Ibrahim and solicit to ALLAH and go ahead towards Kabah with this Duaa.
<p style="text-align: center;"><strong>اللَّهُمَّ صَلِّ عَلَى مُحَمَّدٍ وسلم, اللَّهُمَّ افْتَحْ لِي أَبْوَابَ رَحْمَتِكَ</strong></p>
7. Keep your eyes fixed at Baitullah and continuously Say:
<p style="text-align: center;"><strong>اللّهُ أكبر اللّهُ أكبر, لا إلَهَ الا اللّه, اللّهُ أكبر اللّهُ اكبر, و لِلّه الحمدَ</strong></p>
When you complete all above procedure then move on for Tawaaf.
2: Tawaaf:
<p style="text-align: justify;">Its mean is walk around Kabah 7 times; the pilgrims walk start on their left. When arrive at Kabah then stop reciting Talbiyyah and must do ablution. Men must uncover the shoulder in entire Tawaaf, this is called Idtiba’a, and after the tawaf men cover both shoulders.</p>
<p style="text-align: justify;">“Abdullah ibn Abbas narrated: “The Messenger of Allah ﷺ and his companions performed Umrah from al-Ji’ranah. They went quickly round the House (the Kaaba) moving their shoulders proudly. They put their upper garments under their armpits and threw the ends over their left shoulders.” [Narrated in Sunan Abu Dawud]</p>
<p style="text-align: justify;">(Whilst touching/pointing) for men, walk fastly during the first 3 rounds of Tawaf and walk normally during the other 4 rounds. Once you reach the Yamani corner, either Touch it with your right hand (do not kiss it), and say بِسْمِ اللَّهِ, اللّهُ أكبر or if unable, then continue without gesturing or saying anything from the Yamani corner to the Black Stone, drecite.</p>
<p style="text-align: center;">رَبَّنَا آتِنَا فِي الدُّنْيَا حَسَنَة ً وَفِي الآخِرَةِ حَسَنَة ً وَقِنَا عَذَابَ النَّار</p>
<p style="text-align: justify;">When they will reach at Rukh Al Yamani (the fourth corner of Kabah) they should touch Hijra e Aswa.
After Completing Tawaf, proceed to Maqaam‐e Ibrahim, at the End of Seven circles they will do Istilam (touch or kiss the Black Stone “hazray aswat”) and say</p>
<p style="text-align: center;"><strong>بِسْمِ اللَّهِ, اللّهُ أكبر وَاتَّخِذُوْا مِنْ مَّقَامِ إِبْرَاهِيْمَ مُصَلًّى</strong></p>
Then offer 2 rakat of nawafil on Muqam-e- Ibrahim without covering their heads.

• Zamzam
<p style="text-align: justify;">after that go to zamzam, which is situated in the basement of Haram to drink the water (Zamzam) while standing and saying “بِسْمِ اللَّهِ and supplicate to Allah</p>
<p style="text-align: center;"><strong>اللَّهُمَّ إِنِّي أَسْأَلُكَ عِلْمَاً نَافِعَاًً وَرِزْقَاً وَاسِعَاًَ وَشِفَاءً مِنْ كُلِّ دَاءٍ</strong></p>
&nbsp;

3: Sa’ye:
<p style="text-align: justify;">In Umrah Sa’ey meaning is to run/ walk back forth seven times between the hills of Safah &amp; Marwa which are situated to the North and South of the house of Allah.
When you leaving the boundry of Masjid, must recite this Dua:</p>
<p style="text-align: center;"><strong>بِسْمِ اللَّهِ, وَ الصلاة والسلام عَلَى رسول الله, اللَّهُمَّ إِنِّي أَسْأَلُكَ مِنْ فَضْلِكَ,</strong></p>
Approaching on the Mount Safaa, the following verse is recited
<p style="text-align: center;"><strong>إِنَّ الصَّفَا وَالْمَرْوَةَ مِنْ شَعَآئِرِ اللَّهِ فَمَنْ حَجَّ الْبَيْتَ أَوِ اعْتَمَرَ فَلاَ جُنَاحَ عَلَيْهِ أَنْ يَطَّوَّفَ بِهِمَا وَمَنْ تَطَوَّعَ خَيْراً فَإِنَّ اللَّهَ شَاكِرٌ عَلِيْم نَبْدَأُ بِمَا بَدَأَ اللَّهُ بِه</strong></p>
Then climb upon Mount Safaa, move face to the Kiblah, raise your hands and recite 3 times:
<p style="text-align: center;"><strong>اللّهُ أكبر, اللّهُ أكبر, اللّهُ أكبر</strong>
<strong>لاَ إِلَهَ إِلاَّ اللَّهُ وَحْدَهُ لاَ شَرِيْكَ لَه، لَهُ الْمُلْكُ وَ لَهُ الْحَمْدُ يُحْيِي وَ يُمِيْتُ وَ هُوَ عَلَى كُلِّ شَيْءٍ قَدِيْر؛ لاَ إِلَهَ إِلاَّ اللَّهُ وَحْدَهُ لاَ شَرِيْكَ لَه، أَنْجَزَ وَعْدَهُ وَ نَصَرَ عَبْدَهُ وَ هَزَمَ الأَحْزَابَ وَ حْدَه</strong></p>
The seventh trip will end at Marwa, after this the pilgrim will offer two rakat navafil once again.

4: Halaq
<p style="text-align: justify;">After Sa’yee male pilgrims will get shave their heads completely, females will trim their hair equal to a length of a fingertip. In this way Umrah will be completed. You can leave Ihram.</p>
<p style="text-align: justify;">For further details you can easily visit our website www.faremakers.com or call us (0800 00747). We are available 24/7 hours to our customers because make your travel free of tension is our first duty. </div>', N'<p style="text-align: justify;">Virtual Reality has completely altered our lifestyles. The things which were inaccessible to us can now be obtained without much hassle. This new form of tourism not only saves time and resources, but it also enables the middle class families to discover their favorite places by just sitting at home.</p>

<p style="text-align: justify;">The coronavirus pandemic has further compelled the travel enthusiasts to utilize virtual tours. From the churches of Paris to the palaces of London, people are experiencing the glamour of famous places only through virtual tours. In our today’s piece, we will be discussing about the places in London where you can go virtually. The list of places will certainly help you to add a lively flavor to your self-isolation days.</p>

<h3>1.	<span style="text-decoration: underline;">Tower Of London</span>:</h3>

<p style="text-align: justify;">You can decode the charismatic class of Tower of London through the audio and video guided virtual tours. The tower is situated near the bank of the River Thames and is famous for housing both the vile criminals and Crown Jewels. A guide will assist this virtual tour and bring to the fore the historical perspectives of this site. The mesmerizing views of battlements in the backdrop of lush green pastures are nothing short of a heaven. Amazingly, people will have the opportunity to watch the precious jewels of the royal family. Lastly, the glossy photographs of successive kings and queens are sure to dazzle your eyes.</p>

<h3>2.	<span style="text-decoration: underline;">The Churchill War Rooms</span>:</h3>

<p style="text-align: justify;">This historically significant place is located near the Bletchley Park, a site that was one of the most important tactical locations for the Allied Forces in the World War I. It is believed that all the important war strategies of allied forces were conceived here. Its smoke filled rooms and claustrophobic corridors still rejuvenate the memories of the bloodiest war in the history of mankind. During the virtual tour, you will see the various sections from where the Churchill was giving orders. You will also find exciting old stuff such as typewriters, telephones, and the official documents.</p>

<h3>3.	<span style="text-decoration: underline;">Twickenham Stadium</span>:</h3>

<p style="text-align: justify;">This stadium is significant for a couple of reasons as it has hosted the concerts of several famous singers. Similarly the Rugby League’s Challenging Cup finals were also held here. Sports fans must take the virtual tour of this stadium to see the panoramic and elegant images from all the angles. The tour will tell you how it feels like to watch match live from the stadium. The flashy images of the players playing rugby and the crowd chanting slogans will catch your gaze for good. The tour even offers you to choose the team that you want to see in the stadium. If you come here physically, you will also find lots of <a href="https://www.faremakers.com/hotels"><strong>Cheap Hotels</strong></a> in the vicinity.</p>

<h3>4.	<span style="text-decoration: underline;">10 Downing Street</span>:</h3>

<p style="text-align: justify;">10 Downing Street is an uncontestable jewel in the crown of UK. It is believed it has been serving as home for the British prime ministers since 1735. Google Arts and Culture offer an impressive virtual tour of the 10 Downing Street. Viewers will be taken to the special rooms where they can witness the possessions of the prime minister. Similarly, you will also see the meeting room where the members of parliament are called to discuss the matters of state. There is also a magnificent staircase, which has the beautiful portraits of every UK prime minister.</p>

<h3>5.	<span style="text-decoration: underline;">Buckingham Palace</span>:</h3>

<p style="text-align: justify;">Buckingham Palace is an epitome of luxury and lavishness. Its spacious halls and the highly precious rooms can be seen online. The palace has a huge collection of arts that features the work of acclaimed artists including Vermeer and Rembrandt. The administration of London has termed this place the most iconic and prettiest landmarks in the city. If you go there physically, you can only visit the rooms in the summer months as they are closed for public in winter. Undoubtedly, your virtual tour of London would never complete without exploring the grandeur of Buckingham Palace.</p>

<h3>6.	<span style="text-decoration: underline;">Royal Albert Hall</span>:</h3>

<p style="text-align: justify;">Before the deadly pandemic of coronavirus, people would gather here in thousands for the musical concerts. However, it is out of the question now because of the lockdown. But still, you can get the glimpse of the glitz and glamour of this hall by touring virtually. The 360-degree panorama will enable you to walk around the enthralling auditorium. The remarkable opulence of this hall will compel you to extend your virtual tour for many hours. It sheer grandiosity is the primary reason why the local as well as international artists love to perform here. Before the pandemic, people would book <a href="https://www.faremakers.com/"><strong>Cheap Flights Tickets</strong></a> to attend the concerts here.</p>

<h3><span style="text-decoration: underline;">Conclusion</span>:</h3>

<p style="text-align: justify;">You will get lost for hours in the online tours of London. From the mysterious architecture to the spacious stadiums, these tours will allow you to explore everything. So, don’t wait and make your lockdown days enjoyable by taking the virtual tours of London.</p>', N'virtual-tours-to-experience-london-city-from-home', N'Hamza Farooq', NULL, 376, 1, CAST(N'2020-05-12T15:00:00.0000000+00:00' AS DateTimeOffset), CAST(N'2024-03-19T14:16:25.3966667+00:00' AS DateTimeOffset), CAST(N'2024-03-19T14:16:25.3966667+00:00' AS DateTimeOffset), 1)

INSERT [dbo].[Blogs] ([id], [mainTitle], [shortDescription], [description], [headerUrl], [author], [img], [visits], [isActive], [publishDate], [createdAt], [updatedAt], [blogTypeId]) VALUES (199, N'Never Forget These 7 Things Before Going To Japan', N'
<div class="custShortContent">



	<div class="custImageBlog">


		<img src="https://firebasestorage.googleapis.com/v0/b/faremakers-connect.appspot.com/o/blogimages%2F84384293-13ae-404a-9556-5d95d5fd83bf.gif?alt=media&token=6782a4b9-e6ba-44f8-ab9f-3d0d0d2210c4" alt="things-to-know-about-japan" title="things-to-know-about-japan" class="picture" />

	</div>



	<div class="custTitle">


	    <p></p>


	</div>


</div>', N'<p style="text-align: justify;">Japan is one of the most industrialized nations. The rich culture of the country dates back thousands of years. Indeed, long before many of the spectacular western churches were built, Japan already had some of the most prestigious buildings. From the serene bamboo forests and dazzling skyscrapers to the enthralling temples, Japan is like nowhere else on the planet. The people here are polite, food is incredible, and the country has one of the most sophisticated public transport systems in the world.</p>

<p style="text-align: justify;">Since the country has a plethora of enchanting places, a visit here through <a href="https://www.faremakers.com/"><strong>Cheap Flight Tickets</strong></a> is a must in your lifetime. However, like many other countries, Japan also has some regulations and norms that must be followed by foreigners. You must learn how to behave on certain occasions and how to respect Japanese culture. Today, we are going to discuss some vital things that you must need to learn in order to make the best out of your stay in Japan. Let’s start.</p>

<h3>1.	<span style="text-decoration: underline;">Japan Has No Street Names</span>:</h3>

<p style="text-align: justify;">Before the arrival of GPS and smartphones, finding addresses was the real challenge in Japan. For example, you could not have known where an officer lived or on which street a famous restaurant was located. It is because there are no street names in Japan. Even though some major thoroughfares do have a name, but it is not enough to precisely locate a place. It means that finding a place in Japan is really tricky. However, if you have GPS on your mobile, then you can easily check the addresses.</p>

<h3>2.	<span style="text-decoration: underline;">Japan Has Four Seasons</span>:</h3>

<p style="text-align: justify;">It is of utmost importance to check the weather forecast before packing for Japan. Since the country has four different seasons, it is possible that Japan is beating the heat while you are shivering with cold in your country. Plus, it is also entirely possible that one place in Japan is hot, while the other one is getting cold at the same time. The high altitude areas are relatively chilly, whereas central Japan remains stable.</p>

<p>
<strong>Must Read:</strong> <a style="color:Purple;" href="https://blog.faremakers.com/Blog/2020/1/27/5-important-things-to-know-before-travel-to-manchester"><strong>Things To Know About Manchester</strong></a>
</p>

<h3>3.	<span style="text-decoration: underline;">Cash Is Everywhere</span>:</h3>

<p style="text-align: justify;">Like many other countries, the Japanese are still struggling with the dilemma of cash. So, instead of sending the payments on the bank account, the owners pay their employees in cash. Similarly, most of the hotels and shopping malls also do not accept the ATM or debit card, and the only option you have is to pay them in cash. So, never forget to bring a lot of money in cash before entering the country. However, if you are without cash, you can head to 7-Eleven, where you can conveniently use ATM.</p>

<h3>4.	<span style="text-decoration: underline;">Never Tip In Japan</span>:</h3>

<p style="text-align: justify;">It is vital. After entering the country through <a href="https://www.faremakers.com/turkish-airlines-flights"><strong>Turkish Airlines Booking</strong></a>, never tip under any circumstances. Tipping in Japan is considered a sign of arrogance and rudeness. The waiters might think that you are pretending to be a rich person and that you are trying to subjugate them. No matter how delicious the food or how vigilant the management is, never show your gratitude with money. You can just make an X sign with your fingers to show your appreciation.</p>

<h3>5.	<span style="text-decoration: underline;">Taking Off Your Shoes In The Restaurants</span>:</h3>

<p style="text-align: justify;">Once you have finalized where you will eat, never forget to enter the hotel or restaurant without taking off your shoes. It is widely known that the Japanese don’t wear shoes in their homes, and this can also apply to restaurants and at some public places too. As soon as you enter the hotel, the waiter will point out where you can store your shoes. Some shops even provide the customers with slippers so that they can conveniently go to the washroom.</p>

<h3>6.	<span style="text-decoration: underline;">Smoking Is Not Allowed Everywhere</span>:</h3>

<p style="text-align: justify;">Like in many countries of Asia, smoking in public places is completely forbidden. However, there are some designated smoking areas near the big shopping malls and buildings where you can go and smoke freely. Smoking in public areas is deemed disrespectful and derogatory. If a cop finds you while you are smoking, then he can impose heavy fines on you. The offense is so risky that it might land you behind bars. So, if you want to save yourself from being stalked by the police, be careful while smoking.</p>

<h3>7.	<span style="text-decoration: underline;">Day-Life And The Nightlife Is Entirely Different</span>:</h3>

<p style="text-align: justify;">As soon as the sun sets, you will start feeling a change in the atmosphere. The people who were quiet until now will become enthusiastic and passionate. Japanese think that nighttime is a time for drinks, festivities, and recreations. In the daytime, you might need to lower your tone, but at night, nobody will mind even if you shout out loud. Similarly, markets are filled with jeering crowds who sing the songs and sometimes dance in public places.</p>

<h3><span style="text-decoration: underline;">Conclusion</span>:</h3>

<p style="text-align: justify;">There are also various other things which you will only learn once you visit the country. <div class="custShortContent">



	<div class="custImageBlog">


		<img src="https://firebasestorage.googleapis.com/v0/b/faremakers-connect.appspot.com/o/blogimages%2F84384293-13ae-404a-9556-5d95d5fd83bf.gif?alt=media&token=6782a4b9-e6ba-44f8-ab9f-3d0d0d2210c4" alt="traveling-with-kids" title="traveling-with-kids" class="picture" />

	</div>



	<div class="custTitle">


	    <p></p>


	</div>


</div>', N'<p style="text-align: justify;">Traveling with the kids can be the most fascinating experience, but if not managed properly, it can be a complete disaster. When we travel alone, we do whatever we want, but once we become parents, it becomes crucial to make a few changes in our otherwise crazy behavior. From long packing lists and eccentric kids to the uncertain schedules and unavoidable circumstances, everything might get challenging along the way.</p>

<p style="text-align: justify;">However, some useful tips can save you from going insane while you are traveling with your kids after acquiring <a href="https://www.faremakers.com/"><strong>Cheap Air Tickets</strong></a>. It is your right to travel with your kids as often as you can, and no obstruction should be coming in your way. To help you manage the coherent trip planning, we have come up with 8 tips. You will fully enjoy your family trip if you strictly adhere to these smart ideas.</p>

<h3>1.	<span style="text-decoration: underline;">Pack Wisely</span>:</h3>

<p style="text-align: justify;">Packing for a long family vacation is not a walk in the park. Apart from managing your own gear, you are also supposed to handle everything your children need for the trip. Your children would certainly not survive without the necessary items, including blankets, bedtime books, electronic toys, and delicious noodles. Some important things you can pack are socks, rain jackets, cold weather gear, sun hat, and shoes, etc.</p>

<h3>2.	<span style="text-decoration: underline;">Bring A Stroller</span>:</h3>

<p style="text-align: justify;">Most of the kids are not steady walkers, and you will inevitably need a stroller to manage their jet lag. You might have to walk for miles during the tour, and kids can''t endure such an arduous journey. A light stroller would help you to take your kid from one place to another conveniently. The stroller can also act as a temporary bed, given that you can insulate it with blankets and rain covers.</p>

<strong>Must Read:</strong> <a style="color:Purple;" href="https://blog.faremakers.com/Blog/2020/1/7/5-safety-travel-tips-for-women"><strong>Travel Tips For Women</strong></a>

<h3>3.	<span style="text-decoration: underline;">Bring Snacks</span>:</h3>

<p style="text-align: justify;">Your kids might not like the meals of the plane, and it is a good idea to bring snacks they are accustomed to and that do not break the custom laws. The kids are less likely to vomit if they are familiar with the snacks. Because finding your child sick during the flight would be the most disturbing feeling. Once you are inside the airport, you can buy some fruit cups that are adored by all the children.</p>

<h3>4.	<span style="text-decoration: underline;">Book Hotel Near The Road</span>:</h3>

<p style="text-align: justify;">Staying at a place that is near to the central town or road will save you from walking too far. It will also help the teenagers to play safely and explore the town by themselves. Similarly, the main roads usually contain various shops from which you can easily buy anything. Booking your hotel away from the central road will isolate you, and your children would have a hard time enjoying the precious moments.</p>

<h3>5.	<span style="text-decoration: underline;">Always Travel With First-Aid Kit</span>:</h3>

<p style="text-align: justify;">Your kids can get sick at any time while traveling. They might start having headaches, or some of them might catch flu due to the changing weather patterns. To combat this challenge, always bring a first-aid kit while you travel. Plus, also get thorough know-how of the nearest hospital to your traveling destination. The first-aid kit can also be acquired through <a href="https://www.faremakers.com/flight-promotion-deals"><strong>Airline Flight Deals</strong></a> that are offered for the convenience of passengers.</p>

<h3>6.	<span style="text-decoration: underline;">Utilize Technology</span>:</h3>

<p style="text-align: justify;">Even though you do not want your children to watch the TV at home, you have to break this rule during the trip. Turning on the screens of your mobile will not only grab their attention, but it would also prove to be a source of entertainment. Your children will perceive this as some sort of gift, and they would feel immensely happy after watching a movie or cartoon.</p>

<h3>7.	<span style="text-decoration: underline;">Tackle The Time Zone Difference</span>:</h3>

<p style="text-align: justify;">If you are going to another country, then the time zone will certainly affect your children’s sleeping patterns. Various studies tell us that the younger the child, the harder it is for him to overcome jet lag. Some children can even take a week to adjust to the different time zone. So, you must manage the routine of your children in such a way that they could adapt to the new time zone.</p>

<h3>8.	<span style="text-decoration: underline;">Let Your Kids Play</span>:</h3>

<p style="text-align: justify;">Most of the kids are single-minded, and the only thing they want is to play! So, you must give them enough time and space to have fun. The best way to do this is to look for hotels with a pool and garden. Go to the nearby restaurants once in a while and ask your children to enjoy at the play lands. You should also stop at playgrounds and play various games with your children. Your kids will never forget this experience, and an eternal image of hospitality will be imprinted on their young minds.</p>

<h3><span style="text-decoration: underline;">Final Thoughts</span>:</h3>

<p style="text-align: justify;">During the tour, it is also vital to break your routine to make life a bit easier. Your family is the most valuable thing for you, and you need to give every second of your life to your family to embrace the new experiences. Wait no further, and book the cheap flights for your family from <strong>faremakers.com</strong>, Pakistan’s leading travel channel.</p>', N'8-critical-tips-for-traveling-with-kids', N'Hamza Farooq', NULL, 744, 1, CAST(N'2020-01-08T15:00:00.0000000+00:00' AS DateTimeOffset), CAST(N'2024-03-19T14:16:25.3966667+00:00' AS DateTimeOffset), CAST(N'2024-03-19T14:16:25.3966667+00:00' AS DateTimeOffset), 1)
GO

It is not only the tallest building in the world, but also the titles of the tallest free-standing structure in the world, the tallest observation deck in the world, and the longest distance elevator in the world.</p>

<p style="text-align: justify;">A trip to the observation deck, which offers panoramic views of Dubai, is a tourist attraction for most visitors, although, for those who suffer from vertigo, it will be best missed. <h3><span style="text-decoration: underline;">Heart of Sharjah</span>:</h3>

<p style="text-align: justify;">Heart of Sharjah gives you a complete picture of a forgotten era from decades ago. To date, it is the largest cultural heritage site in Sharjah. Currently, in the first phase of development, this place is a love letter to history and tradition. The implementation is to be completed by the end of 2025. Every effort has been made to preserve the details and aura of the mid-90s.</p>

<p style="text-align: justify;">The vision of the project is to preserve the cultural heritage for future generations. It is also conveniently located close to the main city centers. They also love to explore the essence of this magical city that has been attracting millions of people for the past several years.</p>

<p style="text-align: justify;">Our today’s piece will focus solely on the enchanting places in Jakarta. These gems will not only broaden your perspective on tourism, but they will also enable you admire the things that are generally overlooked by majority of people. Let’s embark on our journey to explore the enigmatic ambience of Jakarta.</p>

<h3>1.	<span style="text-decoration: underline;">Istiqlal Mosque</span>:</h3>

<p style="text-align: justify;">Nobody can think of leaving Jakarta without enduring the spirituality of the mosques. Istiqlal Mosque is a place that not only empowers the visitors with spiritual tidings, but also provides them with the glimpse of Muslim architecture. Its majesty and grandeur is sure to leave you stunned and speechless. Being one of the biggest mosques in Southeast Asia, Istiqlal Mosque will never betray your expectations. The pleasant environment outside will also compel you to fall in love with it. Not only does it host the locals, but it also attracts the prominent world leaders. King Salman of Saudi Arabia, Barack Obama, and several distinguished personalities have visited this mosque to get the tranquility of soul.</p>

<h3>2.	<span style="text-decoration: underline;">National Gallery</span>:</h3>

<p style="text-align: justify;">National Gallery in Jakarta entails all the things that an art lover can ever desire. The gallery was built in 1999 and has been illustrating the contemporary artwork since then. Most of the artwork pieces in this gallery have been designed by the famous artists including Redan Saleh and Affandi, thereby enhancing the interest of locals in the Indonesian art culture. In addition, the international designers have also contributed towards the growth of Indonesian art culture by creating the classical sculptures.</p>

<p>
<strong>Must Read:</strong> <a style="color:Purple;" href="https://blog.faremakers.com/Blog/2020/5/9/pia-operate-special-flights-for-us"><strong>PIA Special Flights For US</strong></a>
</p>

<h3>3.	<span style="text-decoration: underline;">The National Monument</span>:</h3>

<p style="text-align: justify;">The iconic National Monument must be included in your Jakarta travel. It is basically a 132m high building that was erected to pay tribute to the independence struggle. You have multiple options to explore the ins and outs of this landmark: either you can climb to the top to witness the breathtaking views of the city, or you can stand on the ground and marvel at the elegant architecture. Apart from flooded by the local tourists, the National Monument is also frequently visited by the international travel enthusiasts who come here to admire the classical feat of engineering.</p>

<h3>4.	<span style="text-decoration: underline;">Kota Tua</span>:</h3>

<p style="text-align: justify;">One of the most historically significant parts of Jakarta, Kota Tua is awash with the architectures of Dutch Colonial period. People term this spot as cultural heart of Jakarta because of the beautiful surroundings and serene atmosphere. History lovers can head to the nearby museums, whereas the cycling aficionados can take part in the informal cycling race. Here, you will also see a number of students who try to garner the historical knowledge of the country for their pieces of research. If you want to get <a href="https://www.faremakers.com/"><strong>Cheap Flights Tickets</strong></a> for Jakarta, you should book them in advance.</p>

<h3>5.	<span style="text-decoration: underline;">Thousand Islands</span>:</h3>

<p style="text-align: justify;">Undoubtedly, Thousand Islands is a perfect place to escape from the hubbub of the city. This place will enable you to get rid of the fast running life and endure the serenity of nature. It is located north of the Jakarta’s coast and is free for everyone. Beaches, resorts, and restaurants are the hallmarks of this spot. Coming here and dipping in the Indonesian sunshine should be your best bet. Surprisingly, you can also take a boat ride if you want to see the nearby greenery from one point to another. Thrill seekers and nature lovers should definitely come here to uplift their spirits.</p>

<h3>6.	<span style="text-decoration: underline;">Menteng</span>:</h3>

<p style="text-align: justify;">Menteng is the shopping hub of Jakarta. The place is amazingly famous among those who are always thinking about buying new things. From textiles and furniture to the arts and groceries, people can get huge range of things here. The shopping markets in this place are believed to have started in as late as 1970. The precious antiques and the elegant wood carvings are the primary things people are crazy about. Since the market is half kilometre long, you will find here all kinds of shops that offer the products in varying rates.</p>

<h3><span style="text-decoration: underline;">Final Thoughts</span>:</h3>

<p style="text-align: justify;">Historically rich and culturally diverse, Jakarta is ready to embrace your presence. Though the city is loud and crowded, it is certainly not boring. <h3><span style="text-decoration: underline;">The News</span>:</h3>

The carrier said it introduced the service due to increasing imports and exports between Europe and Pakistan. <p style="text-align: justify;">On the other hand, a tropical storm had different ideas for people on board this long-distance service. <p style="text-align: justify;">The aircraft crew attempted twice to land the airline flight in Hong Kong but aborted at about 1,500. After failing to land, the crew opted to fly to the Ninoy Aquino International Airport of Manila.</p>

But the airline has landed in Hong Kong successfully. The flight crew was concerned for the passengers on board the plane, and the airline started its apologies for the difficulty.</p>

<center><h2><span style="text-decoration: underline;">Testing Requirements</span>:</h2></center>

<h3><span style="text-decoration: underline;">Test Upon Arrival</span>:</h3>

<p style="text-align: justify;">Upon arrival, all passengers will also receive a COVID-19 PCR test. Even if you are traveling from a country on the green list, you need to isolate until test results are available, usually 12-24 hours.</p>

<h3><span style="text-decoration: underline;">Before Flight</span>:</h3>

<p style="text-align: justify;">To board your flight to Abu Dhabi, all passengers must complete a PCR test no later than 96 hours before departure and provide proof of negative results.</p>

<h3><span style="text-decoration: underline;">Test on Eighth Day for Quarantine Countries</span>:</h3>

<p style="text-align: justify;">Travelers who arrive from countries NOT on the green list and who are required to undergo 10-day quarantine must perform a PCR test on the eighth day of their trip to be released from quarantine on day 10 and have a wristband removed.</p>

<h3><span style="text-decoration: underline;">Test on Sixth Day and Twelfth Day for Green Countries</span>:</h3>

<p style="text-align: justify;">Travelers who come from the green countries and are therefore released from the 10days quarantine must also undergo a PCR test on the Sixth and Twelfth day of travel.</p>

<h3><span style="text-decoration: underline;">Vaccine Exceptions</span>:</h3>

<p style="text-align: justify;">Abu Dhabi announced that any UAE resident who participates in vaccination trials or the National Immunization Program will also be released from quarantine, even if they are from a country outside the green list. Currently, this only applies to residents of the United Arab Emirates but shows some progress with countries starting to modify entry requirements based on vaccine exposure.</p>', N'abu-dhabi-has-been-announced-to-be-reopened-for-tourism', N'Muhammad Ibrahim', NULL, 627, 1, CAST(N'2021-01-16T10:00:00.0000000+00:00' AS DateTimeOffset), CAST(N'2024-03-19T14:16:25.3966667+00:00' AS DateTimeOffset), CAST(N'2024-03-19T14:16:25.3966667+00:00' AS DateTimeOffset), 1)
