<h3>1.	<span style="text-decoration: underline;">Avoid Interaction With The People Who Are Sick</span>:</h3>

<p style="text-align: justify;">Various people who have contracted the disease have reported symptoms such as fever, headaches, chills, and sore throat. Some of them have also claimed they had difficulty breathing. So, you must avoid contact with people with the same kinds of symptoms. If you see someone with coughing or runny noses, never come close to him.</p>

<h3>2.	<span style="text-decoration: underline;">Wear A Mask</span>:</h3>

<p style="text-align: justify;">Although doctors are saying that wearing a face-mask is not very helpful, it would mitigate the symptoms of infection and virus. It would also protect you from the virulent germs present in the air. So, as soon as you land in China, go to a nearby medical store and buy a good mask. Also, ask your friends to do the same so that the germs should not transfer when they sneeze or cough.</p>

<h3>3.	<span style="text-decoration: underline;">Don’t Touch Your Body Parts With Unwashed Hands</span>:</h3>

<p style="text-align: justify;">You should wash your hands frequently with a good soap. Make sure to scrub for more than 20 seconds. And if your hands are unwashed, then do not touch your nose, eyes, or mouth. Doing so will only exacerbate the problem as the germs can transfer from your hands to your mouth. If you are not comfortable with soap, then you can carry a small hand wash with you.</p>

<h3>4.	<span style="text-decoration: underline;">Don’t Go Near The Animals</span>:</h3>

<p style="text-align: justify;">Scientists have traced the corona virus to a local market with live animals. They also think that it might have transferred from snakes and bats to the people. Some doctors also say that the horseshoe bats are also a cause for the spread of the disease. So, if you are planning to go to Chinese zoos, immediately halt your plans and stay inside your home.</p>

<h3>5.	<span style="text-decoration: underline;">Immediately Go To The Doctor If You Notice The Symptoms</span>:</h3>

<p style="text-align: justify;">If you think that you are getting ill, head right away to the reputable health authorities. Tell the doctor your complete travel history and inform him about your condition. The virus can be curtailed if you control it in the initial stages. Things might get worse if the disease prolongs.</p>

<h3><span style="text-decoration: underline;">Conclusion</span>:</h3>

<p style="text-align: justify;">Prevention is always better than the cure. If you carefully follow our guidelines, not only will you be on a safe side, but your journey will also furnish smoothly. <h3><span style="text-decoration: underline;">Freedom Trail</span>!</h3>

<p style="text-align: justify;">If you are a familiar with Boston, you would already know what Freedom Trail is. It is one of the most famous spots in the whole of Boston, visited by thousands of people. The best this about this spot is that it is only about 3 kilometres long, but it covers 16 different city landmarks. All the landmarks are essential in terms of local history, but they are also crucial in the basic history of the United States.</p>

<p style="text-align: justify;">You will be guided along the way with the remarks available on the information board. We recommend you read those pieces of information to understand better what Freedom Trail is all about.</p>

<h3><span style="text-decoration: underline;">Castle Island</span>!</h3>

<p style="text-align: justify;">Castle Island, as the name suggests, is one of the most visited Castles in the city. The most exciting fact about this spot is that it covers more than 8.9 hectares or 22 acres. It was created back in 1634, which means that it is also one of the oldest yet most beautiful castles located in that area. Visiting this place with cheap flights to Boston is no less than a treat as it tells you about the history of Boston and provides you with a great ambience and atmosphere that multiple enjoyable activities.</p>

<h3><span style="text-decoration: underline;">Quincy Market</span>!</h3>

<p style="text-align: justify;">If you want to purchase goods for your loved ones, family member, or friends, then Quincy Market is the way to go. It was built back in the early 1800s, and it currently plays a vital role to meet the shopping needs of the people living in that area.</p>

<p style="text-align: justify;">The most attractive part of this market is that it’s built with red bricks and granite. Moreover, it appears to be a Roman building because of its unique architecture and structural design. Primarily when the market was first established, people use to come here to buy fresh products. But now you can buy almost anything from here along with tasty meals.</p>

<h3><span style="text-decoration: underline;">Boston Public Garden</span>!</h3>

It has a wide variety of plants and some rare species as well, where you can go to feed your nature-loving appetite.</p>

<h3><span style="text-decoration: underline;">Franklin Park Zoo</span>!</h3>

<p style="text-align: justify;">If you visit Boston this year with your family and kids, don’t forget to visit Franklin Park Zoo. It provides you with the best opportunity to explore the city with your little ones. It covers a staggering 29 hectares or 72 acres of space, and it was opened for the first time back in 1912. There are collectively more than 200 different animal species, including some of the rare ones. There are other parts of this zoo which are:</p>

<ul>
<li>The Kalahari Kingdom</li>
<li>The Tropical Forest</li>
<li>The Outback Forest</li>
<li>The Bird’s World</li>
<li>The Serengeti Crossing</li>
</ul>

<p style="text-align: justify;">We recommend you visit all of them one by one to see all types and sizes of different animals. Moreover, the zoo also offers multiple places where you can eat and enjoy and have a nice little picnic with your family.</p>

<h3><span style="text-decoration: underline;">MIT Museum</span>!</h3>

<p style="text-align: justify;">MIT museum is for all those people who love science in one way or the other. MIT stands for Massachusetts Institute of Technology, and the factor that stands this museum out is that it’s one of the most famous and appreciated museums on the whole planet. It was created way back in 1971, and if you are a science student, then we recommend you to visit this place this year if you are planning to book cheap flights to Boston. <h3><span style="text-decoration: underline;">Things To Keep While Traveling To Avoid The Covid-19</span>:</h3>

<p style="text-align: justify;">The 12-acre park is made up of four distinct areas, including the restored Arthur J. Will Memorial Fountain, an intimate lawn, a community terrace, and a grand lawn. The cave is only about 50 feet long, making it more of a tunnel. Due to the cave''s small size, it is usually filmed at an angle to make it appear much larger than it is.</p>

<h3><span style="text-decoration: underline;">Descanso Gardens</span>:</h3>

<h3><span style="text-decoration: underline;">The News</span>:</h3>

<p style="text-align: justify;">Air Sial will create competition with other Pakistani airlines, Prime Minister Imran Khan said after the inauguration of the new Sialkot airline on Wednesday. AirSial is Pakistan''s third private airline. Its first Airbus A320 plane landed last month at the Jinnah International Airport in Karachi from the US. The airline had to delay since June due to the COVID-19 pandemic and subsequent air travel restrictions.</p>

<h3><span style="text-decoration: underline;">The Schedule</span>:</h3>

You’ll be able to take the following flights for this airline
<ul>
<li>Karachi to Islamabad Flights.</li>
<li>Islamabad to Karachi Flights.</li>
<li>Karachi to Lahore Flights.</li>
<li><a href="https://www.faremakers.com/flights/cheap-flights-from-lahore-to-karachi"><strong>Lahore to Karachi Flights</strong></a>.	</li>
<li>Karachi to Sialkot Flights.</li>
<li>Sialkot to Karachi Flights.</li>
<li>Karachi to Peshawar Flights.</li>
<li>Peshawar to Karachi Flights.</li>
</ul>
All of these flights will be available all days of the week.

<h3><span style="text-decoration: underline;">Planes leased by AirSial</span>:</h3>

<p style="text-align: justify;">Pakistan''s initial airline AirSial picked up its second aircraft, the Airbus A320, from Sialkot Airport this week. The carrier''s underlying activities will depend on three Airbus A320-200 airplanes that the aircraft rented from AerCap, an airplane renting monster situated in Dublin.It will initially start regular flights between Karachi, Islamabad, Lahore, Sialkot, and Peshawar.</p>

<p style="text-align: justify;">The airline hopes to embark on an international journey with the Middle East as the first region within two years and the UAE to be the most preferred choice for the first airline abroad, aviation experts say.</p>

<p>
<strong>Must Read:</strong> <a style="color:Purple;" href="https://blog.faremakers.com/Blog/2020/12/8/virgin-atlantic-to-launch-direct-flights-from-pakistan-to-london"><strong>Virgin Atlantic To Launch Direct Flights From LHE To LHR</strong></a>
</p>

<h3><span style="text-decoration: underline;">It''s a Project from Sialkot</span>:</h3>

<p style="text-align: justify;">AirSial, which aims to become the region''s leading airline, is the brainchild of members of the Sialkot Chamber of Commerce and Industry after the successful launch of Sialkot International Airport. The airport project, completed in 2007, at a cost of approximately4 billion Pakistani rupees, was funded by 360 members of the business community. The industrialists of the city of Sialkot set a unique precedent when they created the airport to stimulate trade and business activities and to support the city''s exporters and entrepreneurs.</p>

<p style="text-align: justify;">The airline will boost the aviation sector supports Prime Minister Imran Khan''s vision to create jobs, strengthen the economy, and contribute to currency exchange.</p>

<h3><span style="text-decoration: underline;">Pakistani Designers</span>:</h3>

<p style="text-align: justify;">Airlines have a long history of engaging staff uniform designers. In 1966, the crew of Pakistan International Airlines wore a uniform designed by famous French fashion designer Pierre Cardin which is a design still remembered as an icon of elegance and chic.</p>

<p style="text-align: justify;">For the uniforms of the cabin crew members, AirSial turned to Nomi Ansari, Pakistan''s largest fashion designer, and style icon. On its online media page, the aircraft expressed gratitude toward Nomi Ansari for his colossal and indefatigable exertion in forming the outfits in accordance with global principles, giving them the most unobtrusive picture that coordinates our way of life and custom.</p>

<h3><span style="text-decoration: underline;">Verdict</span>:</h3>

<h3><span style="text-decoration: underline;">Who Can Travel to the United Kingdom</span>?</h3>

<p style="text-align: justify;">All visitors to the United Kingdom, including British nationals, must show proof of a negative Covid-19 test that must also be taken within 72 hours of arrival. <li>Namibia</li>
<li>United Arab Emirates</li>
</ul>

<h3><span style="text-decoration: underline;">The Restrictions that You’ll Face</span>!</h3>

<p style="text-align: justify;">Before entering the United Kingdom, all visitors must provide a negative test within the last 72 hours and fill out a Passenger Locator Form. Residents of the United Kingdom returning from countries on the red list must pay for a 10-day hotel quarantine.</p>

<p style="text-align: justify;">These travellers must also buy a quarantine package before arriving in the United Kingdom, which covers their stay in hotel quarantine along with water and food. At the start of the scheme, the UK government announced that it had hired 16 different hotels that offer forty-six thousand rooms in total for the people having air ticket booking and are also subjected to quarantine.</p>

<h3><span style="text-decoration: underline;">Amber List Destinations</span>!</h3>

<p style="text-align: justify;">Test to Release is not available to passengers arriving from countries on the red list who stay in a quarantined hotel. The program does not apply to visitors too:</p>

<ul>

<li>Scotland</li>
<li>Northern Ireland</li>
</ul>

</div>', N'<p style="text-align: justify;">Filled with multicultural cities, UNESCO World Heritage Sites, and astounding beaches, South Africa is a vast country nestled at the southern end of the African continent. From its beguiling towns and blissful coastlines to the extraordinarily fascinating interiors, the country has so many places that it might take a lifetime to explore it fully. However, it would not be sane to explore only a single country for your entire life. People who do not have endless vacations or unlimited money may have to be content with a shorter itinerary. Even if you only have 3 days, you can still discover several of South Africa’s significant highlights. Today’s article is focused on telling people how the short trip of 3 days to South Africa can still prove to be remunerative and rewarding. Let’s start our journey.</p>

<h3><span style="text-decoration: underline;">Day 1</span>:</h3>

<p style="text-align: justify;">After arriving at Cape Town by <a href="https://www.faremakers.com/turkish-airlines-flights"><strong>Turkish Airlines Flights</strong></a>, you will have plenty of options to fulfill your exploration hunger. Cape Town is called the ‘Mother City’ because it offers everything, including beaches, excellent cuisine, mountains, and friendly people. Never forget to look out of the plane window for the Mother City landmarks as your plane circles above the airport.</p>

<p style="text-align: justify;">After that, you can choose from a variety of accommodation places that offer simple as well as 5-star amenities. You can relax for 3-4 hours in the afternoon to revitalize your energies. Two hours before the sunset, go to Bloubergstrand Beach and enjoy watching the kite surfers. You can also capture the photos of the mountain as the sun is setting. For dinner, make your way to the nearby restaurant The Blue Peter, where you will be served with beef rump steaks, grilled burgers, lamb curry, and other delicious delicacies.</p>

<p style="text-align: justify;">After witnessing the rock pools and the frosty waves of the beach, it’s time to return to your hotel. You can go back to your resting place through an evening taxi ride or public transport.</p>

<strong>Must Read:</strong> <a style="color:Purple;" href="https://blog.faremakers.com/Blog/2020/1/1/explore-the-beauty-of-palm-island-in-dubai"><strong>Beauty Of Palm Island</strong></a>

<h3><span style="text-decoration: underline;">Day 2</span>:</h3>

<p style="text-align: justify;">In the morning, pick your camera and head towards the scenic suburbs of Cape Town. Boulders Beach is home to endangered African penguins where you can capture the refreshing shots of you standing with the penguins. At this beach, you will also have a chance to see the comical little birds up close. Your next stop should be at Hout Bay. It is a quaint fishing town famous for its picturesque cliff views. You should definitely treat yourself to a seafood lunch before leaving this place.</p>

<p style="text-align: justify;">Now, drive west into the Western Cape Winelands that are full of life and greenery. There are a total of three areas – Paarl, Stellenbosch, and Franschoek, and all of them are littered with wine estates. You can pick any one of the areas and spend the day touring the land, tasting various vintages, and dining on seasonal cuisine. If you are not sure which state to choose, you can book a trip on Franschhoek Wine Tram. This tour will take you through the enthralling scenery of Franschhoek Valley while stopping along the way for tastings at different estates. You can fend off the day’s exhaustion at one of the luxury hotels here.</p>

<h3><span style="text-decoration: underline;">Day 3</span>:</h3>

<p style="text-align: justify;">On the last day of your itinerary, fly to Johannesburg through <a href="https://www.faremakers.com/"><strong>Cheap Airline Tickets</strong></a> and spend the entire day sightseeing. As soon as you land on the city’s surface, get a taxi and head to Shesha Tuk. Here, you will have the opportunity to capture your photo in front of the statue of Nelson Mandela. You can go to the nearby Mushroom Park for an orderly stroll. However, if you are feeling adventurous, then a hot-air balloon ride would be a perfect choice. Obviously, your trip to South Africa would not complete without going to Lilies leaf Farm. It is a historic site and a former camp for liberation leadership.</p>

<p style="text-align: justify;">In the afternoon, make your way into the city’s dense and happening core. Go to the Constitution Hill and observe the Old Fort Prison, where Gandhi was imprisoned. After that, visit the Rosebank Craft Market and buy some locally made treasures to bring the souvenirs back home. Plus, never forget to visit the Cradle of Humankind, a UNESCO World Heritage Site that will take you to the days of ancient civilization.  At the end of the day, try something spicy for lunch and go back to the O.R Tambo International Airport, where you will conveniently get the flight for your home country.</p>

<h3><span style="text-decoration: underline;">Final Thoughts</span>:</h3>

<p style="text-align: justify;">The beauty and the magic of South Africa will surely compel you to stay here even longer. Even if you spend 365 days of the year in South Africa, you will still be missing plenty of things. Therefore, just head to the places mentioned here and join the club of people who have successfully experienced the magnificence of this country. Don’t wait, and strike South Africa hard with <strong>faremakers.com</strong></p>', N'how-to-spend-72-hours-in-south-africa', N'Hamza Farooq', NULL, 845, 1, CAST(N'2020-01-01T15:00:00.0000000+00:00' AS DateTimeOffset), CAST(N'2024-03-19T14:16:25.3966667+00:00' AS DateTimeOffset), CAST(N'2024-03-19T14:16:25.3966667+00:00' AS DateTimeOffset), 1)

	<div class="custImageBlog">


		<img src="https://firebasestorage.googleapis.com/v0/b/faremakers-connect.appspot.com/o/blogimages%2F84384293-13ae-404a-9556-5d95d5fd83bf.gif?alt=media&token=6782a4b9-e6ba-44f8-ab9f-3d0d0d2210c4" alt="saudi-arabia-resume-international-flights" title="saudi-arabia-resume-international-flights" class="picture" />

</div>', N'<p style="text-align: justify;">As you already know that flight operations especially the international ones of many countries are still not resumed because of the Covid-19. But today we have great news for you that might change your future travel plans especially from or to Saudi Arabia. Keep on reading this article carefully to understand how this news about <a href="https://www.faremakers.com/saudi-arabian-airline-flights"><strong>Saudi Airlines</strong></a> and others is going to affect your next international travel plans if you are planning to visit Saudi Arabia.</p>

<h3><span style="text-decoration: underline;">The News</span>!</h3>

<p style="text-align: justify;">The GACA (General Authority of Civil Aviation) of Saudi Arabia had announced today (on 12th March 2021) that all the international flights to and from Saudi Arabia will be resuming on 17th May 2021 (5th Shawwal). All the international airports are going to open and will start operating normally on this day all across the Kingdom of Saudi Arabia just like they used to do before the global pandemic.</p>

<p style="text-align: justify;">The GACA (General Authority of Civil Aviation) had already announced on 11th March 2021 (Wednesday) and sent a circular to all the airlines as well operation in the country including Saudi Airlines which is the flagship carrier of the Kingdom. The earlier circular also contained the change of date as the previous date was different and the circular was to inform all the citizens that all of the airports are now opening.</p>

<p>
<strong>Must Read:</strong> <a style="color:Purple;" href="https://blog.faremakers.com/Blog/2021/3/10/pia-resume-flights-from-multiple-routes"><strong>PIA Resume Multiple Flights</strong></a>
</p>

<h3><span style="text-decoration: underline;">The Details of the Circular</span>!</h3>

<p style="text-align: justify;">According to the latest circular by GACA (General Authority of Civil Aviation) the action will be taken on 17th May 2021 (5th Shawwal 1442) at right 1:00 am.</p>
<p style="text-align: justify;">In the earlier circular that was issued back on 12th January 2021, the General Authority of Civil Aviation stated that all the airports will reopen on 31st March 2021. But due to the changing needs and changing circumstances the Kingdom of Saudi Arabia has decided to open the international airline borders and all the international airports two weeks earlier.</p>

<p style="text-align: justify;">The GACA (General Authority of Civil Aviation) has also stressed following the necessary and important rules and regulations that are already in place. All the precautionary measures and safety protocols are to be followed strictly in order to minimize and eliminate the chances of spreading the virus. Regardless of the <a href="https://www.faremakers.com/"><strong>Air Travel</strong></a> type and the airline the rules are to be followed by everyone.</p>

<h3><span style="text-decoration: underline;">Important Considerations</span>!</h3>


<p style="text-align: justify;">It’s also important to note that not all countries and airlines including Saudi Airlines will be able to travel to Saudi Arabia. The authority said that the rules about the countries on the restricted list are still the same and they are to be followed till further notice.</p>

<p style="text-align: justify;">The authority source at the inside service said the choice was taken dependent on the well being service''s explanation that the COVID-19 antibody producers were late in conveying contracted bunches on time.</p>

<p style="text-align: justify;">The source added the transition to broaden the date was made because of the significance of arriving at undeniable degrees of local area resistance in Saudi Arabia before movement is allowed, considering a potential second influx of the pandemic in numerous nations, in light of a legitimate concern for general well being in the Kingdom and to keep up low contamination rates.</p>

<h3>2.	<span style="text-decoration: underline;">Sunscreen</span>:</h3>

<p style="text-align: justify;">In the Australia the sun-rays are as strong as the winter snow. So, if you are traveling in the summer or winter does not matter, you will go for the sunbath near the white sandy beach to spend the time under the sun umbrella, and then you should have all the sunscreens to protect your skin. Might a few of you are thinking that, only two or three time sunbathing nothing danger for us without sunbath, but the care is better because the sun-rays in the this country are very strong and it will blistering you skin. During the luggage packing, you should put sunscreen moisture in your bag, don’t buy it from the exploring destination because its price is high in that country as compare to our country.</p>

<h3>3.	<span style="text-decoration: underline;">Carry Extra Money With You</span>:</h3>

<p style="text-align: justify;">If you really want to make your first backpacker travel as the professional travel, in which you are nothing forget or perform any missing that turn it into the error. <p style="text-align: justify;">Definitely, the backpacker traveling isn’t too much costly, the reality should faced it that the Sydney and the Melbourne are the expensive cities and even Australia is not too much cheap destination as from the others , but it’s not too much expensive that no one can’t afford. <h3>4.	<span style="text-decoration: underline;">Meet With Locals</span>:</h3>

<p style="text-align: justify;">As the backpacker or the visitor, you should respect the Australians and their tradition because you need to spend the time there with them. If you have the strong understanding with them, then your time passed with the perfect consumption. They will share with you the authentic information regarding the Australia, its history, tradition & culture and telling you the stories that you ever heard before about this country. The locals of the Australia are very friendly and they will guide you without any prank, but you should verify from two to three people the same question asking.</p>

<h3>5.	<span style="text-decoration: underline;">Transportation</span>:</h3>

<p style="text-align: justify;">The best and the reasonable source to cover the distance between the Australia cities and the attraction site are by bus. <h3><span style="text-decoration: underline;">Al Shallal Amusement Park</span>:</h3>

<p style="text-align: justify;">Enjoy a night of rides and games at Al Shallal Amusement Park, one of Saudi Arabia''s most popular theme parks. Ideally suited for the whole family, this park offers thrill rides, children''s rides, boat rides, arcade games, and an ice rink. It is also home to several shops and food stalls as well as two full-service restaurants. 
The best and most probably the unique thing about this park is that it opens daily at 5 p.m. and operates until late at night, its rides lighting up the starry sky.</p>

<h3><span style="text-decoration: underline;">Silver Sands Beach</span>:</h3>

<p style="text-align: justify;">Fine white sand and gorgeous turquoise waters await you at Silver Sands Beach, a private beach on the Red Sea. <p style="text-align: justify;">With three floors and hundreds of stores, the Mall of Arabia is a mall where it''s easy to spend all day shopping. <p style="text-align: justify;">A giant food court on the ground floor houses various Saudi and international restaurants and cafes where you can enjoy a full meal or have a light snack.</p>

<h3><span style="text-decoration: underline;">Fakieh Aquarium</span>:</h3>

<p style="text-align: justify;">All tourists, young and old alike, will enjoy a trip to Fakieh Aquarium, Saudi Arabia''s only public aquarium. This Jeddah aquatic zoo is home to more than 200 marine species, including sharks, rays, sea lions, and seahorses. Visitors can also watch a dolphin show or even swim with the friendly cetaceans for an additional fee. It''s one of the best places for your little ones if you are taking your Saudi Arabian airline flights with your family. At the end of your aquarium visit, shop for a fun souvenir at one of the many shops and enjoy fresh seafood at the Blue Ocean Restaurant.</p>

<h3><span style="text-decoration: underline;">King Fahd Water Jet</span>:</h3>

<p style="text-align: justify;">One of the most popular tourist attractions in Jeddah is the King Fahd Water Jet, which is the highest water jet in the world. It projects a jet of water from the Red Sea to a height of more than 240 meters. Although the water jet is visible during the day from many places in the city, it is much more impressive at night when illuminated by hundreds of spotlights. This unique water jet is among the best modern things to see in Jeddah.</p>

<h3><span style="text-decoration: underline;">Al Rahma Mosque</span>:</h3>

<p style="text-align: justify;">At high tide, the incredible Al Rahma Mosque seems to float on the Red Sea. This mosque stands on the edge of the Jeddah Corniche, a 30 km long coastal stretch where tourist attractions abound. Although it features traditional architecture and Islamic art, this floating mosque is also equipped for worship with a modern sound and lighting system. It is perhaps the best spot to visit in Jeddah and is substantially more fascinating to see at the crack of dawn or nightfall when the light channels through the stained-glass windows.</p>

<h3><span style="text-decoration: underline;">Al Baik</span>:</h3>

</div>', N'<p style="text-align: justify;">Pakistan is one of the most beautiful countries in the world. From the misty peaks and mesmerizing beaches to the magical makeovers and marvelous historical architecture, Pakistan is gifted inconceivably. Plus, the Land of Pure has four seasons that have the potential to enthrall anyone. It is a land where the Sufi Saints used to reside, where Allama Iqbal, the most influential person of the 20th century, was born, and where all the things have a magical beauty!</p>

<p style="text-align: justify;">Everyone wants to visit Pakistan at <a href="https://www.faremakers.com/"><strong>Cheap Flight Tickets</strong></a>. Be it traveling, hotel, or accommodation, every tourist desires to get the best deals so that he or she could save a little money. But you can only get the best deals of flights and hotels if you have a solid knowledge of the imperative tourism related things. Our today’s piece is aimed at telling the people how they can get the perfect deals and make their journey to Pakistan unforgettable. Let’s get started.</p>

<h3><span style="text-decoration: underline;">Best Deals On Flights</span>:</h3>

<p style="text-align: justify;">If you want to visit each and every breathtaking place in Pakistan, then we suggest you book the online air ticket. Needless to say, it is not prudent to go everywhere by road. Pakistan is home to the so many fascinating sites that it might take you an entire year to satiate your exploration hunger. Nonetheless, traveling by air is not only convenient but also time-saving.</p>

<p style="text-align: justify;">There are various airlines the can take you from one part of the country to another without any hassle. Apart from providing the customers with top-notch traveling facilities, these airlines also offer amazing promotions and discounts that can be availed on specific occasions. The three most used airlines for the domestic travel of Pakistan are:</p>
<ul>
<li>Pakistan International Airline (PIA).</li>
<li>Air blue.</li>
<li>Serene Air.</li>
</ul>
<p style="text-align: justify;">Here, we are going to discuss the promotions, offers, and flight deals for every airline.</p>

<h3><span style="text-decoration: underline;">Pakistan International Airline</span>:</h3>

<p style="text-align: justify;">PIA is the official and the largest airline of Pakistan. The airline has its hubs in Karachi, Islamabad, and Lahore, from where it flies to domestic as well as international destinations. Currently, the airline possesses over 35 aircraft, including Airbus A-320 and Boeing-777. Whether you are planning to witness the marvelous beauty of the northern areas of Pakistan or to observe the ancient architecture of the Gandhara civilization, PIA will smoothly fly you there!</p>

<h3><span style="text-decoration: underline;">Best Deals Of PIA</span>:</h3>

<p style="text-align: justify;">The national flag carrier of Pakistan provides the consumers with various astonishing offers and discounts. Generally, discounts and promotions are offered on special events, including Eids, National Festivals, Hajj, Umrah, and other sporting events. You can enjoy the miraculous discount offers if you book your PIA flight from faremakers.com. Usually, the discounts are offered on:</p>
<ul>
<li>Baggage.</li>
<li>Extra Miles.</li>
<li>Hajj and Umrah travel.</li>
</ul>

<strong>Must Read:</strong> <a style="color:Purple;" href="https://blog.faremakers.com/Blog/2019/11/26/pia-has-added-a-new-aircraft-airbus-a320"><strong>PIA New Aircraft</strong></a>

<h3><span style="text-decoration: underline;">Airblue</span>:</h3>

<p style="text-align: justify;">Airblue is the 2nd largest airline in Pakistan after PIA. It is a privately-owned airline with its headquarter in Islamabad. Apart from taking the passengers to the local destinations in Pakistan, the airline also has scheduled flights to Saudi Arabia, Oman, and United Arab Emirates. It has a total of 10 aircraft in its fleet, including Airbus A320-200 and Airbus A321-200. The majority of Pakistanis prefer Airblue given the quality of services and low fares.</p>

<h3><span style="text-decoration: underline;">Best Deals Of Airblue</span>:</h3>

<p style="text-align: justify;">Satisfying the passengers with stellar services is the hallmark of the Airblue. Like PIA, it also offers a plethora of discounts and promotions for the passengers. It has active management that ensures that your travel plans go without a hitch. You can get the discounts and the promotions of this airline by booking your ticket through faremakers.com. Each year, Airblue offers deals on the following occasions:</p>
<ul>
<li>Women’s day.</li>
<li>Hajj and Umrah.</li>
<li>Independence Day.</li>
<li>Eid festivals.</li>
</ul>
<h3><span style="text-decoration: underline;">Serene Air</span>:</h3>

<p style="text-align: justify;">Established in 2017, Serene Air is the major domestic airline in Pakistan. It carries three aircraft of Boeing 737-800 that operate in the six major cities of Pakistan including Lahore, Karachi, Peshawar, Quetta, Islamabad, and Faisalabad. In just two years, the airline has become immensely popular due to its unparalleled services and active management.</p>

<h3><span style="text-decoration: underline;">Best Deals Of Serene Air</span>:</h3>

<p style="text-align: justify;">Serene Air offers amazing deals and discounts for its passengers. If you book several tickets at once through <a href="https://www.faremakers.com/serene-air-flights"><strong>Serene Airlines Online Flights Booking</strong></a>, then the charges for each ticket would be reduced, and you would receive the promotional codes. Last but not least, the airline also offers Ramadan Packages where passengers can enjoy enormous discounts.</p>

<h3><span style="text-decoration: underline;">Best Deals On Resorts</span>:</h3>

<p style="text-align: justify;">While visiting the elegant areas of Pakistan, you will see various resorts that are famous for their accommodation services and cuisine. Most resorts are located at the hilltops, and sitting beside the windows of the rooms and looking at outside mountains would be an indescribable experience. Most of the resorts in Pakistan are not cheap, and it is not possible for all people to afford such high rates. But, if you book resorts through faremakers.com, then you will certainly be able to not only save your bucks but also create unforgettable memories. Here, we are going to discuss all the resorts in Pakistan from where you can easily get the best resort deals.</p>

<h3>1.	<span style="text-decoration: underline;">Escape Resort, Kallar Kahar</span>:</h3>

<p style="text-align: justify;">Escape Hotel offers the best accommodation services in the Kallar Kahar region. All the rooms have seating areas and a flat-screen TV. Plus, the Wi-Fi can be accessed anywhere near the resort. If you land at Islamabad Airport, then you can conveniently reach the resort as it is only 112km from the airport.</p>

<h3>2.	<span style="text-decoration: underline;">Arcadian Riverside, Naran</span>:</h3>

<p style="text-align: justify;">Located in the scenic valley of Naran, the Arcadian Riverside has a large garden and a shared lounge. The amenities of warm water and free WiFi are available here. Plus, guests can also enjoy a buffet or continental meals. The resort offers discounts in the summer months as the prices of meals and accommodation go down.</p>

<h3>3.	<span style="text-decoration: underline;">Ayun Fort, Chitral</span>:</h3>

<p style="text-align: justify;">The resort is just a 30-minute drive from the Chitral Airport. In the beginning, there were limited rooms in the resort, but now with the addition of multiple rooms, this exclusive place is open for your holidays. The resort has lovely gardens, pristine orchards, dazzling mountain scenery, and the exquisite Pakistani cuisine, thus making it a perfect place for your break.</p>

<h3>4.	<span style="text-decoration: underline;">Whispering Pines, Islamabad</span>:</h3>

<p style="text-align: justify;">Located in the heart of Margalla Hills, Whispering Pines is a dreamland designed to attract the local as well as international tourist market. All the adventurers and nature lovers reside here whenever they want to explore the beauty of Islamabad. People of Lahore generally visit Islamabad between Mar and June because the <a href="https://www.faremakers.com/flights/cheap-flights-from-lahore-to-islamabad"><strong>Lahore To Islamabad Air Ticket Price</strong></a> goes down during these months.</p>

<h3><span style="text-decoration: underline;">Best Hotel Deals</span>:</h3>

<p style="text-align: justify;">One of the cardinal things to choose when visiting a new country is a hotel with perfect accommodation, pleasing interior, tasty food, and hospitable management. Here at Faremakers, we have a wide range of hotels that can cater to the needs of not only the middle-class households but also the wealthy families. Let’s have a look at some of the hotels that are widely known for luxurious amenities and cheap rates.</p>

<h3>1.	<span style="text-decoration: underline;">Swat Continental, Mingora</span>:</h3>

<p style="text-align: justify;">Situated on Saidu Shareef road of Mingora district, Swat Continental is a budget category hotel which offers all the modern amenities. The hotel has 29 rooms, and each of the rooms has the facility of TV, air conditioner, cold and warm water, and the satellite. Plus, the hotel also offers the traditional tribal cuisine which will compel you to lick your fingers.</p>

<h3>2.	<span style="text-decoration: underline;">Neelum Moon, Neelum Valley</span>:</h3>

<p style="text-align: justify;">The hotel looks like an inn from paradise. It has all the features that could help you connect with nature. Not only will you be able to witness the magnificent mountains, but you will also have the chance to watch the flowing stream alongside the valley. You can also hire local guides from the hotel who can inform you about the ins and outs of the valley.</p>

<h3><span style="text-decoration: underline;">Distance From The Ill Person</span>:</h3>

<p style="text-align: justify;">If you find any sick person near you or the person who has the respiratory illness, must maintain the distance from him because the virus is starting condition is the high fever and the respiratory disorder.</p>

<h3><span style="text-decoration: underline;">Avoid Crowded Place</span>:</h3>

<p style="text-align: justify;">The report highlights the initiatives taken by the incumbent government and to what extent these endeavors have affected tourism. <h3><span style="text-decoration: underline;">2015/2016</span>:</h3>

<h3><span style="text-decoration: underline;">About Lahore (LHE)</span>:</h3>

<p style="text-align: justify;">The second-largest city in the country, Lahore, is the capital of the Pakistani province of Punjab. Lahore, which dates back to almost millennia, is also the main cultural center of Punjab and Pakistan. The city is bordered to the north by the Ravi River, and the land has a hot, semi-arid climate characterized by extremely hot summers, dry and warm winters, small monsoons, and dust storms. The area includes the 11th-century remnants of epochs belonging to various rulers. The city is also a repository for its art, cuisine, music, cultural, film, and garden events.</p>

<p style="text-align: justify;">As the land provides an affiliate platform for poets and artists, many educational institutions can be found here. The Mughals have always had the kind of grace and charm they wove into their finger''s centuries ago, and the proof that he is looking stands here on this earth. Being the heart of Pakistan, the city is full of buildings, castles, palaces, and mosques that testify to the Mughal grandeur and are the perfect blend of more than one architectural style.</p>

</div>', N'<p style="text-align: justify;">Lahore (Pakistan) is very famous among the tourists because of its attraction sites, historical places, cultural cuisine taste, old city beauty, variety of markets and bazaars with huge varieties, lot of restaurants which gives unique food taste to the outsiders, due to all above factors Lahore exist in my traveler bucket list on the top one. Am too much curious to exploring this city because many time I heard to my friend’s words that (Lahore Lahore hai) and also mention many historical context that Lahore city is heart of Punjab. Therefore without wasting any single minute I did <a href="https://www.faremakers.com/   "><strong>Online Flight Booking</strong></a> for Lahore. And all facts about Lahore city come true when I visited, now even Lahore is my Favorite and ideal old city. Now am going to share with you my trip in my words.</p>

<h3> <span style="text-decoration: underline;">Lahore Fort:</span></h3>

<p style="text-align: justify;">The Lahore fort is also famous with the name of Shahi Qila, because it was built by the One of the Mahmood Ghaznavi in 11th century. It is a glorious Mughal Palace that must visit. In which many halls, mosques like (Moti Masjid), gardens, beautiful princess rooms, and all other construction was very royal and marvelous. Its roof too much heighted, the big doors in which Shahi sawari was easily pass away. Sheesh Mahal also tells about its past beauty. Fort is the actual beauty of Lahore history.</p>

<h3> <span style="text-decoration: underline;">Badshahi Mosque:</span></h3>

<p style="text-align: justify;">The Badshahi Mosque is one of the famous in the world and it was built in the year 1674 by Aurangzeb, the Mughal emperor. According to reports, in this mosque around 40,000 people can easily come at one time for worship in a single prayer session. The most interesting thing about it is that it is made entirely of red sandstone. Its beauty, gracefulness, elegance is the Mughal culture achievement. You also enjoy this history of <a href="https://www.faremakers.com/   "><strong>Domestic Flight Booking</strong></a>.</p>

<h3> <span style="text-decoration: underline;">M M Alam Road:</span></h3>

<p style="text-align: justify;">Muhammad Mahmood Alam, a very well-known figure of the Pakistan Air Force. The fact that some of the greatest restaurants in Lahore are located on this beautifully designed road is one of the major reasons for visiting this area. There are many restaurants to impress any foodie. Similarly, this Food Street is also another place to enjoy the smell and taste of all the delicious dishes that Lahore has to offer.</p>

<h3> <span style="text-decoration: underline;">Anarkali Bazar:</span></h3>

<p style="text-align: justify;">In anarkali bazaar shopping was the great experience. This bazar was establishes many year ago. Plenty of shops, stalls are in this market that all have different variety of items, necessities and grocery. Different food stalls are available in this market. Every tourist must visit this market for shopping because this is the famous one market.</p>

<h3> <span style="text-decoration: underline;">Masjid Wazir Khan:</span></h3>

<p style="text-align: justify;">Masjid wazir khan is the religious attraction in the Lahore, it famous due to its wall interior and large place of worship. This was build during the ruling time of Shah Jahan the Mugal Emperor. The tourist can take picture there, the scene of picture so real and natural because all masjid cover with green orchards and beautiful walk area.</p>

<h3> <span style="text-decoration: underline;">Minar-e-Pakistan:</span></h3>

<p style="text-align: justify;">It is the monument of the ideology of Pakistan. This monument is located in the country’s largest Iqbal Park of Lahore. Built during the 1960s, it holds a special patriotic sentiment for the country as on this site the Lahore Resolution was passed by the All-India Muslim League on 23rd of March, 1940. Visitors come there on every 23 march to recall the success of Muslins and it is also famous and favorite one of the tourists.</p>

<h3> <span style="text-decoration: underline;">Wagah Border:</span></h3>

<p style="text-align: justify;">Tour to Lahore not complete without visiting Wagah Border, This place marks the border between Pakistan and, India. Every evening tourists came to the Wagha Border to see its ceremony that organized by the Pak Army and Indian soldiers. The cheering crowd and the elaborate drill on both sides is something which every visitor should experience before leaving the city of Lahore. I also enjoyed this border ceremony in my tour.</p>

<h3> <span style="text-decoration: underline;">Lahore Museum:</span></h3>

<p style="text-align: justify;">Lahore Museum is the perfect place to learn about the fascinating history of Pakistan. This museum was established in the 18th century, and contains artifacts from the times of the civilization of Mohenjodaro and Harrapa to the present day. Its almost 20 galleries which exhibit different priceless Qurans, paintings, Gandharan sculpture, carpets, manuscripts, Islamic artworks and many other such artifact.</p>

<h3> <span style="text-decoration: underline;">Shalamar Garden:</span></h3>

<p style="text-align: justify;">Who love nature, the Shalamar Garden of Lahore should be the ideal getaway from the hustle and bustle of this city for a while. This garden is involved in UNESCO World Heritage Site. It was also built in the year 1641 by Shah Jahan, the Mughal emperor. More than 75 acres of magnificent Garden is a great example of the famous architectural skills of the Mughal Empire.</p>', N'visiting-lahore-old-city-while-traveling-karachi-to-lahore', N'Aqsa Tayyaba', NULL, 927, 1, CAST(N'2019-05-21T15:00:00.0000000+00:00' AS DateTimeOffset), CAST(N'2024-03-19T14:16:25.3966667+00:00' AS DateTimeOffset), CAST(N'2024-03-19T14:16:25.3966667+00:00' AS DateTimeOffset), 1)

Read about the travel advisory of China before planning to travel Beijing.</p>

<p style="text-align: justify;"><strong>The travel advisory clearly stated in January; do not travel china.</strong></p>

<p style="text-align: justify;">The reason, China was the opening city for the severe pandemic of Covid-19. Its city Wuhan was the hub of this virus. Till 2nd January, all international flights, even <a href="https://www.faremakers.com/china-southern-airlines-flights"><strong>China Southern airlines flight</strong></a>, taking passengers to china, were banned. <p style="text-align: justify;">Since the 23rd of January, all Chinese visa holders were restricted to their places. Investigations were done to check symptoms of the virus in them. The U.S citizens were asked to go to the local embassy and test themselves for Corona. Likewise, they were presented with special health care.</p>

<p>

Some cities of china came under complete control and curfew for a short span of time. Later on, the men and their families were allowed to leave The People republic of China after complete checkup. For this, the authority checked letter was required at the time of boarding.</p>

<h3><span style="text-decoration: underline;">China Is Open To Travelling</span>:</h3>

<p style="text-align: justify;">However, the travel advisory for the passengers of Beijing, is advised to avoided unnecessary travel to China. However, it becomes necessary; the passengers should follow SOPs and shorten their days of the visit. It is compulsory, to remain in touch with the local embassy. For this, carry your health insurance, Visa letter and passport with you, all the time. If you are spotted and caught under the doubt of Corona carrier, so, contact tourist police and the particular embassy.</p>
